stanzas.text:
JEHOVAH the uncreated---
Creator of good things.
From age to age, Thou art the same---
O thou “Ancient of days.”
Thou created man out of the dust,
And gave him breath of life:
Thou made the earth for him to dwell,
For ever and ever.

All good things of the earth,
To the Lord belongeth;
He gives them to His faithful ones,
Who keep His word of truth.

Lord as Thou art, so are we
In Thy form and likeness;
But Thou hath no blood, flesh and bones
And other differences.
Thou coverest Thyself with LIGHT,
And moved upon the wind.
When no heaven nor earth was made,
Thou alone existed.

All o'er Thy glorious body,
Shines brighter than the sun.
Thou sitteth on Thy heav'nly Throne
With bright colours around.
As Amber and Sapphire stone,
Thy Heav'nly Throne doth shine
More gloriously than any throne,
That mortal man can make.

When Thou thought of creating,
“Logos” Thou didst first creat---
Begotten One as Thy delight;
By whom good things were made.
He came on earth as Jesus Christ
To bring us back to Thee.
For, as in Adam all would die,
E'en in Christ shall all live.

MARVELLOUS and great,
O LORD, are Thy works.
Glorious is Thy Throne,
Precious are Thy Ways.
Thy creatures shall praise Thee,
All the world around,
Confessing Thy Goodness.
And Truth to mankind.

Marvellous and great,
Is Thy Love, O GOD.
Thy Justice and Love
To mankind bestowed.
Many are Thy Blessings,
Promised to mankind;
And those who love Thy ways,
Thy Blessings enjoy.

Heaven is Thy Throne,
The earth Thy footstool;
The fullness thereof
Are all from Thee LORD.
Thou dwell not in temples
Made with sinful hands;
But Thy Holy Temple
Is Thy 'nointed ones.

We honour Thy Name,
And honour Thy Ways;
We honour Thy Word
And esteem Thy Love.
Thy Wisdom and Power
Thy Justice and Love
Declare Thy Wondrous Works
All the world around.

“HOLY, holy, holy!
JEHOVAH of hosts!
Earth is full of glory
Of Thee, O LORD of hosts!
Thou only art holy;
There is none beside Thee,
All nations shall come,
LORD to worship Thee.”

“O LORD, holy and true!
Thy works shall praise Thee
In sky, and earth, and sea,
Holy One of Israel!
Holy Father keep us:
For Thy Name's sake keep us
For we trust in Thee,
LORD GOD of Israel!

“Almighty, Most Holy!
Reverend and Holy!
LORD, Thou art above all
In sky, and earth, and sea!
Thou art GOD for ever!
Thy children shall praise Thee,
Casting all their cares
Upon Thee with smiles.”

Holy, Holy Father!
Almighty in Pow'r!
O our Bless-ed Creator!
Thou reigneth ever more;
Father, remember us
Thy own children by grace.
With Thy holy Arm,
LORD, victory is Thine.

ALMIGHTY, Most Holy,
Are Thy Names O LORD of Hosts!
To Thee we come with thanks
And Thy Holy Name to praise.
We thank Thee LORD, for using us
Thy Name to proclaim abroad.

All wisdom, all powers,
Unto Thee Most High belong.
When we come to praise Thee,
What a blessing we have found;
And the faithful ones by Thy grace
Shall reap the good of the Land.

Thou art Justice and Love!
And all good things come from Thee,
By Love, Mercy and Truth,
Thou hast brought us to Thy Light.
But when we had not come to Thee,
We were then without Thy Light.

All glory be given to the LORD:
All glory be given to the LORD.
With thankful praises, for His great
(Love Divine.)

LORD, how valuable is Thy Word,
Which in all what I do I need.
By feeding on this precious Word,
I will from sin and death be saved.

Healing water---Thy Word O Lord,
Maketh hearts of the sinners clean.
Who from their evil ways return,
To seek Thy divine grace O LORD.

I sought, and now I've found the Truth
Of my LORD who loves me dearly.
Now in my heart His precious Words
Abound and make me love His Ways.

MY LORD, how marvellous are Thy works
wonderful and merciful art Thou!
How equitable are Thy Judgements!
O KING Eternal - Almighty One!

Merciful Father - Eternal One,
Grant us Thy Love and Grace
To dwell in Thy Kingdom

Uncreated Creator - Gracious Father!
How Merciful and Loving art Thou!
LORD, look not on our infirmities,
But shew Thy mercies ever on us.

When we’re in sorroweful grief and state
Languishing in our bewilder’d state;
When our slipp’ry vale of death we tread,
We us by Thee O LORD our December will be.

BLESS-ED LORD, when all Thy blessings
Comfort my weary heart!
My heart inclines to rest in peace,
Void of sorrows and pain.

When inspired with the thought “I'm Thine”
What more could words express
Than godly utt'rance of Thy praise?
O Thou “Ancient of Days!”

Thy praise I'll sing from shore to shore
In all my sojourn here.
When Thy wondrous Way I survey,
Guide thy divine light.

Here we stay to learn Thy wisdom;
That we, Thy own, might run.
Orderly life’s crown race to win.
And gain the precious crown.

JEHOVAH GOD of Hosts---
The Holy and Reverend!!
We flee to Thy Kingdom,
For Truth and protection.
LORD, Thine we are;
Now protect us
For Thine we are
O GOD of Hosts.

Thy blessings and Thy peace
Thou giveth those who stay
In Thy Court to obey
Thy true testimonies.
O Thine we are
To dwell with Thee
And to obey,
LORD, in Thy Court.

A goodly hope we have,
LORD, in keeping Thy Truth.
And, as on Thee we build
Our hope, we'll live by faith.
And faithful still
To do Thy will
For ever more,
For Thine we are.

Ye people of the world!
Now sing that “Thine we are”
To our Loving Father
JEHOVAH---Bless-ed GOD.
Sing “Thine we are!”
And now rejoice
In KING of kings.
Sing!

GLORY and praise to our GOD,
Who eternally reigns.
Wisdom within His Throne abide.

Words cannot say of my sweet thoughts,
In God and His Kingdom,
How He called me His Will to do,
Which relieves one from sin.

What can a sinner like me bring,
Or do to seek God's grace?
It is by thorough repentance,
With faith and work in Christ.

Remember me, O GOD for good
In this dark sinful world!
LORD, in my daily task for bread,
Feed me conveniently.

JEHOVAH, the Almighty GOD!
May the earth Thy glory fill;
Where we the “Jonadabs” will dwell
Trusting in Thy “Word of life”

Guide us LORD by Thy Word,
In this woeful sinful world:
Though godless ones abide,
Yet we triumph by Thy Word.

We worship Thee, O LORD of host,
Thou who saves us from our foes;
And though away would roll the years,
O LORD, Thou art same always.

O LORD Thee alone we will serve,
Thro’ our Saviour---Christ Jesus;
With joy we will renew our vows,
To serve Thee in Thy Kingdom.

May Thy Light shine in all we do,
And make it LORD, glorious still;
That we a light to all would be,
Calling all lost ones to Thee.

Thine we are Father of life!
Chosen ones of Thy Kingdom;
Gracious LORD Father of life
Bless us Father; Thine we are.

May Thou with Thy guardian care,
Uphold our thoughts ever more
To think of Thee O Father,
To be Thine, and Thine for'er

Thy love to us is proven
By Christ whom Thou didst send us
To call us to Thy Kingdom;
Though of old we never knew.

LORD, inspire us in Thy Court
To shew forth Thy divine Light;
That we, Thro’ our faithfulness,
May shine in Thy revealed Truth.

GREAT is JEHOVAH God of Hosts!
Whose ways and works are wonderful.
Unsearchable His greatness is!
He the LORD Immortal.

Sing! angels and men,
With cheerful voices.
His Name always praise,
Singing in adoration.

Great is JEHOVAH KING of kings
Who ruleth over all nations!
Before Him bow with thankful hearts;
Extol the KING of kings.

Great is the LORD---“Ancient of days”!
None, O! none is like unto Him!
His bounteous mercies He gives us
Who bow and praise His Name.

Great is the LORD Who cares for us
What else do we care when He's nigh?
E'en let bleak winds of the foe rise.
God is our shield and peace!

Great is JEHOVAH for ever!
All pow'r to Him belong for'er!
His Blessings, Wisdom and Favour
Endureth for ever!

When to His service we attend,
May His Spirit guide us all day.
To learn His Ways our paths to mend,
His is the saving way.

title: OUR FATHER WHO ART IN HEAVEN
subtitle: (Our Lord's Prayer)

stanzas.text:
OUR Father Who art in Heaven,
May rev'rence be Thy Holy Name
On earth now has Thy Kingdom come,
Thy will be done as in Heaven.

Give us this day our daily bread,
And forgive us our trespasses,
As we forgive them that grieve us;
And leave us not in Satan's snares.

Deliver us from sinful lusts,
That in Thy Kingdom we may dwell
Freed and protected by Thy will,
Ever observant of Thy Laws.

ETERNAL Excellency!
Yea, for Thy Lovingkindness,
Are we gathered here this day
To give true service to Thee,
LORD, as we’ve come before Thee,
Make our hearts to love Thy Truth.
And keep our feet in Thy Court,
To be obedient Christians.

KING Eternal bless-ed LORD!
Rain Thy Mercies, LORD on us.
We assemble here this day
To give true service to Thee.
O! with faithful services,
We bear Thy Light to the world;
That they may live in good hope
Of the Bless-ed Promised Land.

The wicked shall not be there;
But righteous ones everywhere.
With triumphant songs of praise,
Shall the earth be filled with joy.
As governors we shall dwell
In Thy Dominion by grace.
In faithfulness we shall live
On that Bless-ed Land of Peace.

EXCEPT the LORD, buildeth the house,
They that buildeth labour in vain.
Except the LORD amend our ways,
Our lives are desp'rate and woeful.

Our God and King stablish our works
Cleanse us from our infirmities.
Help us to serve Thee more and more,
Thy Love to gain for ever more

Man by bread alone does not live,
But by the Truth, the word of God---
The sure fountain of peace and life:
For all who seek Thy precious word.

Most Holy and merciful God
Our gracious King, Loving Saviour,
Renew our hearts to love Thee more,
So that by Thee we will prosper.

FATHER, from whom all blessings flow,
O bless Thy people here on earth.
Let Thy Theocratic love abound,
LORD, with Thy people ever more.

Father, from whom all Wisdom flow,
LORD, give Her to each one of us,
Who dwells faithfully in Thy Mount,
Declaring Thy gospel to all.

GOD of Wisdom, Pow'r and Justice,
May Thy Love be in all we do;
And may Thy precepts be our lamp
To guide our steps to Thy Kingdom.

GIVE me understanding
O God our KING.
Thy Way I have chosen
To tread therein,
Lord, I love Thy precept.
I'll observe it with my heart.
Incline my heart unto Thee,
That I may live.

Thy judgements have I laid
Before me LORD.
Enlarge my heart O LORD
To keep Thy Word
LORD leave me not in shame;
But teach me Thy precious Name,
And incline my heart to love
Thy precious Name.

Teach me Thy Way O LORD
Therein to tread,
For Thy judgements are good,
O Gracious LORD!
Thy Words are my delight.
And they are my Counsellors
For me to seek righteousness
O GOD of grace!

GOD of Peace to lovers of Truth,
May Thy Peace reign with us;
And may Thy wonderful Wisdom
Guide Thy remnant on earth.

Not by faith alone without works,
Nor by works, lest we boast;
But faith with works to do Thy will
In Thy mount, gives us life.

A place to dwell in Thy Kingdom
Is our meditation.
We have no hope in Satan's world,
Where strife and woe abound.

As we from this assembly go,
Grant us Thy divine Peace;
That we, believers of Thy Truth,
Speak of Thy wondrous grace.

GOD our Father, we pledge to Thee
Our works and love of Thee;
As we have been chosen of Thee,
Help us LORD, ne'er to stray

All that we acquire by Thy Name
O LORD in Thy Kingdom.
May they everlastingly be
Undefiled heritage.

The heritage we've got by Thee,
In earnest care may we
Use them for Thy glorious Service;
With joy in Thee always.

Teach us LORD to become good ones,
In Thy Truth in action;
That we may always bring forth fruits,
Meet for our salvation.

GOD, to Thee I renew my vows
With an unwav'ring faith in Thee;
To do Thy will with hope of life
Daily in Thy Tabernacle.

Rescue me, O gracious Father
From the dreadful snares of satan.
Revive me God that I may live
To do Thy will for ever more.

I pray Thee JEHOVAH my strength;
Strengthen the weak and faithless ones,
When duty calls may they arise
And render true noble service.

Brethren, arise and work with faith
God's work is meant for you and me,
And be christians of service true,
For yonder bank, awaits your crown.

MY LORD, whatsoever I speak
Or do in Thy glorious Service
O LORD! Help me that they may be
The patterns of Thy attributes.

LORD, with Patience and tolerance,
Humility and endurance,
In understanding Thy wisdom,
Honour and life shall be obtained

Verily, Thy boundless Wisdom
And wonderful infinite Pow'r,
Thy Justice and Thy bounteous Love,
LORD! Are more than words can express.

title: PRAY WE NOW FOR OUR BRETHREN

stanzas.text:
PRAY we now for our brethren
That God would protect them,
Who trusteth in our Saviour---
Jesus, our Counsellor,
Give them understanding hearts
To live in godliness.
O hear our supplications,
JEHOVAH GOD our KING.

We pray Thee, LORD, our God and (King:
We pray Thee, LORD, send Thy blessings (divine.)
The homes of those who love Thee,
O GOD our Strength and Shield,
O send in them Thy glorious Peace
And may they love Thy ways.

The homes of those who love Thee,
O GOD the King of Peace.
Pour out in them Thy Spirit,
That they may see Thy Light,
And live to expectations
Of truth and love and peace;
That in Thy Name they rejoice
In every honest deed.

We will Thee adore our LORD,
And learn of Thee O GOD.
For bless-ed is the nation,
Who trusteth in Thy Name.
Shew us Thy lovingkindness
O LORD, for Thy Name's sake,
Let us not be confounded,
But blest with Thy goodness.

title: TEACH ME O LORD, GOOD THOUGHT OF THEE

stanzas.text:
TEACH me O Lord, good thought of Thee,
Thy lovingkindness too;
And may my heart remember Thee,
With understanding true.

Teach me to understand Thy will
Thy blessings to enjoy;
For Thy Tabernacle love I,
To dwell and do Thy will

To be wise in Thy law teach me,
And in Thy Light guide me;
That I will have Thy glory true,
E'er shining in my life.

In resistance from satan's snares,
Thy Truth my anchor is.
Teach me to keep Thy Laws O LORD,
To stray not from Thy Word.

ALMIGHTY Father, strong to save!
All we are hopeless without Thee
Thy Wisdom, Pow'r, Justice and Love
O LORD are freely owned from Thee.

Give us Thy grace; give us Thy (strength;
Gracious Father---Eternal One!
Give us Thy Love; give us Thy Truth,
In Thy Kingdom to do Thy will.

LORD, when our ways may slipp'ry be,
We will appeal for help from Thee;
As without Thee our hope is vain,
Consider our supplication.

Almighty Father, KING of kings!
With one accord we've come to Thee,
Thy Kingdom tidings of Freedom
Brings happiness to oppressed souls.

In all our changing scenes of life,
LORD, in Thy Word of Truth we hope;
For Thou art our Shepherd and Hope
Thy Freedom is indeed our need.

ARISE, O LORD of hosts!
With Saving Arm arise!
When storms of life beset,
Disturbing all my ways.

Arise! JEHOVAH GOD arise!
And save me with Thy Mighty Hand!

LORD of Gideon arise!
In Thee, I put my trust;
And in Thy Name rejoice
With cheerful voices true.

Shew Thy marvellous works
To people of the world
And let them now confess
“JEHOVAH is TRUE GOD”

Almighty GOD arise!
Send now prosperity,
LORD, to Thy faithful ones,
Who love to keep Thy Way.

title: GOD OF MERCY TO HUMBLE ONES

stanzas.text:
GOD of Mercy to humble ones,
Of nations on the earth!
Crown us with Thy Victory and Peace
Through all the changing scenes.

With Thy Bless-ed Wisdom and Pow'r
We will silence the foes;
And they with their mouths will confess
That thou alone art GOD.

LORD, we cannot do without Thee
In whatso'er we do;
And let us not be confounded
In all on earth we do.

May we for'er Thy own be called
“JEHOVAH'S Freedomites”
Marching triumphantly in peace
Now to the Promised Land.

title: CHOOSE THOU MY WAY, O LORD

stanzas.text:
CHOOSE Thou my way, O LORD
In Thy truth to remain.
By Thy Mighty Hand lead me LORD
To Eternity Shore.

Guide Thou my steps, O LORD
That I may walk in Thee,
As not to stumble in the way
Though a sinner I am.

Guide Thou my thoughts, O LORD
From satan's lures to flee,
That I may know of Thee my LORD,
For crown of life to gain.

In trouble or distress,
I look for help from Thee;
For Thou art my Shield and Defence---
My Tower and my Guard.

GOD be thou with us,
For in Thee we hope.
And in Thy Kingdom,
LORD, we pray to stay.
In all exhortations,
And Lo! In our pray'rs
We pray Thee, our Father,
O abide with us.

LORD, keep thou ourselves
From going astray.
Help us understand,
O LORD, all Thy laws
With good meditations
Far from worldly lusts.
We hope in Thy goodness,
O LORD, God of Hosts.

JEHOVAH our KING!
In Thee we rejoice.
Now send us Thy Light
With abounding grace.
We, trusting in Thy Name,
No sorrow will have;
But joy of Thy blessings,
Shall fill all our hearts.

title: GOD, BE WITH US AS WE JOURNEY

stanzas.text:
GOD, be with us as we journey
Thro' this evil world of sin.
And may Thy will on earth be done,
As it is in heaven done

May evil thoughts, LORD, from us flee,
And make our hearts always pure.
In all we do may we serve Thee,
And Thy Holy Name to praise.

No refuge here on earth we have,
Besides Thee Almighty GOD.
Guard and guide us Most Holy LORD,
Thro' the various scenes of life.

title: GOD OF MERCY, GOD OF JUSTICE

stanzas.text:
GOD of Mercy, God of Justice,
Hear us when on Thee we call.
May our humble supplications,
Reach Thy Heav'nly Throne O GOD.
Hear us Father, hear us we pray,
We seek Thee in every hour.
In Thy Glorious Kingdom on earth,
Full of love and equity.

We, as birds O then without nests,
Had ones from Thee wondered far.
Oft in sorrow oft in danger,
When Thee we knew not O God.
In Thy Kingdom shelter us LORD,
For to Thee we have returned.
Gracious Father, God of Mercy,
Bless all those who've known Thy Way

title: LORD, FOR THY NAME'S SAKE LEAVE ME NOT

stanzas.text:
. LORD, for Thy Name's sake leave me not
Let not my foes prevail o'er me.
That I will not be a reproach
Amongst the nations to Thy Name.
For this cause, I do love Thy Name
More than things bright and beautiful.
Worldly glories and kingly states,
LORD, can't be equalled with Thy Name

Never was known Thy Pow'rful Name:
Never was heard Thy Holy Name,
When we dwelt in satanic realm
Among the foes---the godless ones.

LORD, Thou art Wonderful and Great!
The heavens, the moon, sun and stars:
The mountains, the seas, and the trees,
Shew forth Thy wondrous works of old.

I now have hope, by serving Thee,
And always will hail Thy great Name.
LORD, leave me not for Thy Name's sake,
That I'd not go astray from Thee.

title: LORD, IN THE CALM AND DARKEST NIGHT

stanzas.text:
LORD, in the calm and darkest night,
O! when sleep may us overtake;
May Thy presence around us shine,
That we awake with brighter light.

LORD, may Thy holy angel guard
And deliver us from the foes,
Who love the night more than the day,
Seeking to rob and to destroy.

May Thy Word be our choicest light,
That when we sleep, we rest with hope
To wake with joy, to see Thy Light,
And face Thy service with delight.

title: MY LORD, FROM PEOPLE OF THE WORLD

stanzas.text:
My LORD, from people of the world
Who have no hope in Thee;
From all their snares deliver me,
That I may live in Thee.

Wash me with Thy water---the Truth,
JEHOVAH GOD of Truth:
And leave me not in temptations,
But from evils save me.

. My Lord, guide my steps in Thy “Way,”
That I may walk aright
In Thy law--- a lamp to my feet,
In Thy Kingdom “The Way.”

Thy presence is fulness of joy;
I'll sing and praise Thy Name.
I thank Thee, LORD, for keeping me
Still in Thy “Way” this day.

title: LORD, WHAT'ER WE'LL DO GREAT OR SMALL

stanzas.text:
LORD, what'er we'll do great or small,
What'er we'll speak or think of Thee,
May they all to Thy glory be,
And be well pleasing in Thy sight.

What'er we do great or small with faith,
What'er we do great or small with faith,
What'er we do, with faith be good in (Thy sight.

LORD, as we tread this woeful world,
Guide us Father to Thy Kingdom;
Lest we stumble without Thine aid,
And fall to rise no more O LORD.

LORD, not the love of canal lusts,
Nor all Satan's pleasures with joy;
But faithfulness and love of Thee,
Will bring us nearer to Thy Throne.

FATHER, at each approaching day,
May the thoughts of Thy bless-ed Realm,
Make strong our new-found thoughts (of Thee,
In faithful works in love each day.

THINK of God's Wonderful Acts,
How He doth His people save
From Satan's oppressive acts,
Throughout changing scenes of life.

Think of His Bountiful Love
Thro' Christ His Belov-ed Son.
Think of His Kingdom on earth,
Full of grace and equity.

Think of His Infinite Pow'r
When various trials you meet:
Think of His Wonders how great,
How he saves us from them all.

Think of His Wonderful Peace,
He doth give His faithful ones:
Think of His mercy divine---
His Goodness never faileth.

title: GOD IS THE ROCK OF HIS PEOPLE

stanzas.text:
. God is the Rock of His people;
Though snares of foes invade our ways,
And ere we call, his presence shines,
With a wonderful saving Arm.

Ere we call, His presence shines
With wonderful saving Arm!
Ere we call, His presence shines,
When snares of foes invade our ways!

To him we give our lives and all,
His purposes to understand.
We learn of Him to do His Will,
And be with Him on golden strand.

Peaceful homes His promise affords,
And gives new life of joyous rest.
No more shall be known dreadful gates,
But everlasting life and peace.

title: GOD IS OUR SHIELD AND CONFIDENCE

stanzas.text:
GOD is our Shield and Confidence,
Thro' land, and sea, and sky.
Deliv'rance He to us affords,
That seek His grace divine.

According to our hope in Him,
He crownest us with joy.
By marvellous acts He protects,
Though dangers may affright.

LORD, Thou art our Refuge and Strength,
A Help in time of ill.
May all that love to do Thy will,
Trust in Thy lasting Strength.

Thou stilleth the storms of the foes
By Thy wonderful acts,
Thou suff'reth not our feet to slide,
By Thy Mercy and Pow'r.

KING of kings, I'm Thine
What a Bless-ed hope!
Trusting in Thy gracious words
Me to save from ill ways.
KING of kings O LORD of Lords!
I am Thine, for ever more.

I am Thine, O my LORD---
My gracious KING---JEHOVAH of Hosts.
I am Thine, my LORD; Trusting in (Thy Name
I am Thine my LORD, my KING my (Creator.

When Thy Truth I heard,
I then leaped with joy;
That I now Thy presence see
For peace and lasting life.
Into Thy Kingdom I flee,
Knowing Thee for crown of life.

Thy Kingdom O LORD
Reigneth over all;
Thy attending blessings fill
My heart with joy and peace.
I am Thine, O LORD of hosts!
LORD, guide me till life I gain.

Grievous days have gone,
Happy days have come;
As in Jesus Christ I live,
Who shed His Blood for me
To redeem me from my sins,
Since I trust in Him my LORD.

title: LORD, IT IS OUR CHOICE TO BE THINE

stanzas.text:
Most Holy One, Thou art our God,
Who makes all our foes to flee;
At the trump of Thy holy Word,
With shameful faces they'll fall.

Now to the world Thy Light is shown,
For the salvation of man,
Thro' our Lord and King---Christ Jesus
Who's now in spirit with us.

title: O LORD GOD, NO HOUR IS AS SWEET!

stanzas.text:
O LORD GOD, no hour is as sweet!
O FATHER, no day is as bright!
Neither is night also as calm,
As when Thy words comfort my heart.

From every sunrise till ev'ning,
LORD, when my daily bread I seek,
Then Thy falling dews crownest me
With Thy never-ceasing Blessings.

No words can tell the joy within
My heart, when Thy presence brightens
My sojourning days amidst foes,
And filleth me with Victory Songs.

LORD, when satanic lusts harass
My onward march to Promised Land,
Thy precious Word will be my lamp.
Guide my steps with Thy mighty hand.

title: THEY THAT ALWAYS TRUST IN THE LORD

stanzas.text:
“THEY that always trust in the LORD.
Like Mountain Zion shall be,
Which indeed cannot be removed,
But for ever abideth.
As mountains 'round Jerusalem,
So the LORD His flock surround
To protect them that trust in Him.
From henceforth for ever more”

“The rod of the wicked shan't rest
On the lot of righteous one;
Lest the righteous will be tempted
To put their hands unto sin.
Do good, O LORD to those that seek
To do good, in Thy Kingdom:
And to the upright ones in heart
Shew Thy lovingkindness true”.

“LORD, as for such that turn aside
Unto their vain crooked ways,
Their lot shall be with evil ones;
But on 'Israel' shall be peace.
Lord our “Captain of Salvation”- 
Jesus, Bless-ed “Prince of Peace”!
Lead us O our Loving Shepherd,
Lord, till the battle be won”.

GOD is my Shepherd, I'll not want;
Down He makes me to lie
In pastures green, He leadeth me
Besides the silent stream.

Thou now restore my hope and life,
And makes me now to thrive
Within the “City of Refuge”.
On Thee my hope is built.

And though through shades of death I tread,
No evil will I dread.
Thou art with me; Thy staff and rod
Shall comfort me, O LORD.

Oh! In the presence of my foes,
A table Thou prepare.
My head Thou with Thy Wisdom fill:
Thy Blessings I will feel.

Goodness and love shall follow me,
All the days of my life.
In God's Tabernacle I'll be,
For ever more in Christ.

ALMIGHTY, Holy Father,
Full of bounteous gift of life!
Thee alone I'll serve to live;
Guide me LORD, in all my ways.
Bless-ed Father!

To my feet, Thy word---a light,
Directing me LORD, aright
Thy precepts to keep and live,
Till this sinful world I leave.
O what a Light!

With the two-edged sword---Thy Word,
Go I boldly in Thy strength;
Trusting that Thy Pow'r will save
Me from all Wiles of the Foe.
O precious Word!

When I hear with joy Thy Name,
Faithfully I run to Thee,
Casting my cares upon Thee,
Father, Thou carest for me.
O what a Name!

FATHER of Wisdom, Gracious God;
Accept our thanksgiving this day.
Not worldly thanks of faithless way,
But faithful thanks to Thee my LORD.

For our Hope in Truth we thank Thee,
Whose favour and love crown our needs.
Our faithful works and love of Thee
Are done Thy blessings to enjoy.

Ourselves we commit to Thy care;
Our thoughts are all to know of Thee.
O! may we ever thank Thee more
For Thy goodness; to Thee we flee.

LORD, we come with thanks Thee to praise;
For so great Thy lovingkindness.
Father of Wisdom, might and grace,
Thou art our Rock, and hope and peace.

For each perfect gift from above,
So freely given us;
We gather with thanks for Thy love
Unto us Lord of Lords.

By faithful deeds and sincere words,
We bring our thanks with praise;
In Thy Tabernacle good Lord,
Crown us always with peace.

Jesus, abroad Thy praise shall be,
For men Thy Light to see.
In all we do, may we know Thee,
And from sins always flee.

The purpose of God is unveiled
In His Tabernacle;
His bless-edness His saints revealed,
Who didst obey His call.

title: HERE IN THE MOUNT OF GOD

stanzas.text:
HERE in the Mount of God we come,
Bringing our off'rings and our vows
For Jehovah's mercies on us.
Praise ye the LORD.

New blessings always from our LORD,
Flow peacefully into our homes.
Now may we as His favoured ones
Praise ye the LORD

O come, O come, ye favoured
Our King of Glory to adore.
In exaltation of His Name,
Praise ye the LORD.

We unitedly Him acclaim,
GOD that wrought wondrous things, not few;
And giveth those who trust in Him,
His riches true.

PRAISE ye the LORD, O brethren,
And always bless His Name.
Sing of His Wonderful Acts,
Which He hath wrought on us!
O worship Him, and thank Him,
And Him only adore
Thro' Jesus Christ our Saviour---
Tabernacle of GOD.

Bless-ed are we O brethren,
Who confess Him our Own.
The goodness of His Wisdom
Has brought us nearer Him.
O worship Him, and thank Him
For His lovingkindness;
And learn His Truth and shun lies
That thou might live in Him.

Now in this day of gladness,
Do, knit your hearts in love,
And “Hail Jehovah and Christ”
In God's Kingdom always
O worship Him and thank Him,
Now fill His House with praise
And thanks, and in Him rejoice
For His Tabernacle.

LORD! Mighty is Thy hand!
To make great, it is Thine
And give strength to Thine own,
Who trusteth in Thy Name.

'Tis Thine O LORD
We give this day
So willingly!
'Tis Thine O LORD!

In our meditation
To seek Thy salvation,
We have this day given
These gifts to be Thine own.

LORD, in sincerity,
We've offered willingly;
And now with joy we see
Thy people here this day.

Our LORD! We know that Thou
Triest the hearts of men,
Whether they seek Thine own
In uprightness to live.

As strangers in Thy sight,
May our hearts keep Thy law
Always to be a light
To guide us ever more.

LORD, with a willing heart,
We pay our vows
O this day in Thy court
Thou most gracious LORD
Receive us with love, O GOD
Our loving Father,
Keeping and blessing us
With divine show'r.

LORD, with a willing heart,
Thee, we will serve;
And praising Thee, we thank
Thee, LORD, We'll not swerve
From Thy---Way to 'promised bank'
Feed us with Thy Word,
That we may not depart
From Thee O LORD.

O GOD of Salem, Gracious LORD,
Bless-ed One of Israel:
Thou in ages doth lead and guard,
And feed Thy children well.

Our lives and off’rings we present
This day with all our hearts
GOD of Salem we'll ne’er resent
To herald loud Thy acts.

LORD, shew Thy light to all Thy race,
And may their troubles cease;
And in Thy Kingdom by Thy grace,
We shall e'er dwell in peace.

UNTO Thee, we give thanks
In Thy Kingdom O GOD.
O Thou Most Holy and Reverend!
Thou spoileth the snares
And the ways of the foes,
And make us free from the wiles of Foe.

We give thanks and rejoice.
Unto Thee, we give thanks and rejoice.

Now, Thy Gospel O LORD
Extends from shore to shore,
Rescuing the lost ones to Thee.
JEHOVAH our GOD!
LORD, may Thy Name be known
In the remotest part of the earth.

Teach us LORD, to become
Good ones of Thy Kingdom;
And bless us in Thy Court below
Thro' Christ our Saviour:
And we thank Thee, O LORD,
For keeping us safe throughout the years.

We thank Thee, Father, our Lord,
For so great Thy love to us.
And Thy wondrous precious word,
Given us Thy own by grace.
For Thy precious Truth we yearn,
And Thy gracious peace we earn.

We thank Thee for this we know
That Thy presence is our joy.
From strength to strength we'll declare
Thy wondrous Acts near and far.
Which to mankind Thou have shown,
Though of old some had not known.

Praise the Lord with one accord
With melodious songs of praise;
And with precious gifts and thanks,
His Kingdom adorned with praise.
Ye people O thank the Lord
For so great His love to us.

Now thank we Lord, our GOD
Creator of mankind,
Who daily feeds His creatures dear,
And clothe them with His care

Though our days be spent here
In vale of death and woe;
Yet, trusting in His loving care,
We'll reach the blissful shore.

O JEHOVAH our GOD
Thine is the ruling rod,
We hope to live by faith in Thee
From Thee our blessing be.

The bless-ed race to run
Thro' Jesus Christ Thy Son.
LORD, give us strength to do Thy will
Our hearts with wisdom fill.

When we shall reign with Thee,
In joy eternally:
The saints above, the meek below---
O, what a glorious band!

And what a “Paradise”
Shall heaven and earth be!
Then no where shall the foe be found,
For righteous ones shall rule.

Now thank we LORD our GOD,
For His mercy on us,
In sending Jesus Christ our Lord
To ransom us from sins.

LORD, hear Thy children sing,
Marching to Land of Peace
For crown of life from Thee our KING
JEHOVAH GOD of Peace.

That which our feeble hands have wrought,
Will to the Throne of God be brought
Now as our faithful thank off'rings,
For His mercies to us we sing.

Render to God His praises due;
Give to him our off'rings, though few,
Knowing of truth it's His to save
Us from satan's perilous wave

O! when we hear His precious word,
We feel His gracious Love divine
And love to do His Will with joy,
Till satan's fold He doth destroy.

God, who in His likeness made us
Will be thro' the ages our Light
And OH! with joy our mouths shall sing---
“Hail JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ”!

HONOUR the Lord with thy substance
And the firstfruits of thy increase;
So shall prosperity abide
In what thou findst to do.

Satan won't prevail on thy ways
By destructive plans of the foes;
But blessings shall with thee abide
In what thou findst to do.

Now give unto God His due thanks
For all His benefits to thee.
Enrich His Store with plenteous gifts
In what thou findst to do.

JEHOVAH, Thy Name we sing
With holy thoughts of Thy praise,
Blessed assurance of Thy grace,
Will Thou give to those who praise
Thee, through Jesus Christ our King.

We've left the world for Thy sake:
We've shun its counterfeit joy
To do Thy Service with joy
In Thy Kingdom, and forsake
World joy of Satan's Way.

Our hearts and hands now we give
To honour and praise Thy Works,
With sincerity of thanks,
And in Thee may we now live,
With godly songs of Thy praise.

O praise JEHOVAH God our King,
For giving us the “bread of life”,
For many years Thou has been our Light
Jehovah God, our Bless-ed King,
Be Thou with us,

Belov-ed brethen in the LORD,
Hallelujah! Rejoice and sing!
For Jehovah God shall be with us, if we work truly in Jesus
Our Lord and King.

O hear, ye people of the world!
Hear the true Gospel of the LORD,
Full of loove and peace and salvation,
Hear ye the Gospel of the LORD,
And be ye saved.

To those who do the will of God,
He doth become their saving Arm
Surely, believing doors of the Word
Shall find deliv’rance from the LORD
Almighty God

'At Jesus Name shall all knees bow',
Of things in heav'n and earth below;
And then with tongues shall they confess,
'Jesus Christ is King of glory'.

'Though He, being in the form of GOD
Thought it not robb'ry to be made
Equal with the Almighty GOD;
Yet, the form of servant He took!

'Being found in fashion as a man,
He humbled Himself and became
Obedient unto shameful death---
The death on tree in “Golgotha”!

'That we, as repentant sinners,
Might receive thro' Christ God's blessings
And everlasting life by grace,
Thro' His precious blood shed for us!

'By Him, for Him, were made good things---
Visible and Invisible;
Whether of thrones and dominions,
Or Principalities and Pow'rs'.

CHRIST is the Way, the Truth, and Life.
Loving Shepherd, Prince of life.
As He loves us, let's then love them
Who do love Him as we do.

Christ's redeeming grace abiding!
We've passed from death unto Life!
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
For this great gift from above.

Christ our Star of Hope and Leader.
And the Dayspring from above.
Defensive Rock---Gracious Saviour;
Guide and guard us safely Home.

Christ the key to goodly treasure---
Hid under the Mercy Seat.
Help us Lord to have such treasure
And glorify Thee with it.

'Lovest thou me'? The Saviour said.
‘Yes! Our voices cried with joy,
Therefore, praise Him ye that were blind
But now have seen the True Way.

'I am He that reigneth,
And rules in Majesty
I am He that reigneth
To save the meek in Christ
Behold! I am alive---
Alive though once was dead.
Behold I am alive---
And reign forever more'.

'I am He that bringeth
The lasting peace of God.
I am He that bringeth
The lasting peace of God.
Behold! I am the Lord,
And Saviour of the world.
I am He that bringeth
The lasting peace of God'.

'I am He that sitteth
At the right hand of God.
I am He that sitteth
At the right hand of God
To rule in Equity,
And Captives to set free
I am He that ruleth
As King of Righteousness'.

'I am he that loveth
The sinners all to save
I am He that shedeth
My blood to save mankind,
Who love me as I do,
And heed my Word of truth.
I am He that loveth
Sinners who love my way'.

'I am He that teacheth
The humble sheep of God.
I am He that teacheth
The humble sheep of God.
Behold! I am the Truth,
And the Way, and the Life---
The Door of the sheep
Who love the Way of Life.’

‘I am He that feedeth
The hungry ones with Truth.
I am He that feedeth
With precious Word of Life.
Behold! All the powers
In Heaven and on earth,
Unto me belongeth,
Now and for ever more'.

JESUS, I love Thee with my heart,
And not by outward lips of praise;
But with sincerity of heart,
In Thy Kingdom to own Thy grace.

The bitterness of my sorrows
No more shall be known, since I bear
Thy yoke to learn of all Thy ways.
My King and Saviour, Thine I am.

Tongues can't express my love for Thee,
How Thou didst die for me on tree;
And yet, Thou counteth it but joy
To ransom a sinner like me.

Jesus, Thou “Sun of Righteousness”
Cometh with healing in Thy wings;
Thy chosen ones on earth to bless,
That in Thy Kingdom they'll rejoice.

MOST Loving and gentle Jesus,
From Thy Throne above hear us,
Now we've come with true devotion,
And to seek Thy salvation.

In Thy Kingdom here on earth
We praise Thee, Lord.

We thank Thee, Jesus, Most Loving
For Thy Kingdom now hath come;
Where God's Will is now abiding,
As in Thy Kingdom above.

O! Jesus Christ our Mediator
And our King and truest Friend:
Doth say, 'Come, O ye sinful ones,
And ye shall have rest and peace'.

No words can tell what blest relief
I've found in Jesus, my Lord;
Nor ears had heard of such relief,
When we knew not Christ our Lord.

Thanks be to Christ, our gracious One,
Who now comes in pow'r to reign
With wondrous light to lead His own
To the Promised Bless-ed Home.

Not by worldly wisdom and might
Shall Thy peace and love be gained
But by keeping Thy precious Light,
Which in ages past was hid.

Days of sorrows and of mourning
Shall not in my heart be known,
Since in Thee, my Lord, I obtain.
Life and peace from Thy Fountain.

RISEN Jesus, our Redeemer,
Who shed His blood to save mankind.
Adorned with immortality,
Hath Thou come now invisibly
To rule the world in equity;
And they who seek Thee will rejoice.

For our sins were Thou slain on tree
To ransom us from sin and death.
Though by Adam's disobedience
Came death upon human creatures,
Yet, by Thy obedience we'll live
Thro' faith in Thee, our Redeemer.

Risen Saviour, our Counsellor,
Who at God's Right Hand now reigneth
In Thy Kingdom for ever more.
Lord, with Thy Mighty Hand, save us
From all the fowler's pestilence,
And make him flee at Thy presence.

BEHOLD, our Faithful Saviour comes
Unseen with clouds descending!
With His gracious wings of healing,
Making whole the sinful ones.

Now He is bidding every mind
And saying, “May I come in”?
“Yea Lord”! says the repentant ones,
Who trust in His precious Word.

May all our Redeemer's merits.
May all His suff'rings and pains.
Be our delight, that we may grow
As true christians of our race.

Lord, give to every thankful mind
Thy rich promises of grace;
And in their hearts, may peace be found
Free from sorrow and from griefs.

LORD, as pris'ners we had waited
For the coming of Thy Light.
Veils of wretchedness and sorrows
Spread across our sinful eyes.
Now Thy glorious Light appearing,
Fill our weary hearts with joy;
Thus dispelling signs of sorrows,
By the Gospel of Thy Truth.

Lord, Thy presence fills us with joy
Of Thy Light---“the Word of life”
In Thy glorious Kingdom on earth---
The desire of mankind;
Fulfilling ages prophecies
Of Thy coming reign on earth.
Though unseen Thy Body with us,
Yet, signs of Thy reign are seen.

When Thy Kingdom shall fill the earth
With Thy glorious reign of peace;
Then no more shall wailing be heard
'Mongst the kindred of the earth,
But signs of peaceful rest and joy;
Love of freedom everywhere,
Shall be known on that Salem Shore---
The Land with beauties around.

CHRIST is reigning, let the nations
From their evil ways repent.
Let this glorious gospel of Christ
Spread to the nations afar.

Christ has come! Christ has come!
Christ now comes to reign in peace
Christ the King! Now has come!
Christ has come to reign in peace.

Long the nations have been wand'ring,
Far from Christ and Peace and Light.
Thro' the gospel message of Christ
Shall they come to Him our King.

With this joyful hope in Jesus,
Let His Kingdom News be spread;
Spread it forth with joy so glorious
To the nations far and wide.

CHRIST now reigns all the world around.
His gospel far and wide doth spread;
This Kingdom news brings life and mirth
With joy of bless-edness on earth.

We give our thanks to Him, and vow
To spread this gospel everywhere.
With words sublime of our Saviour;
Till strife and war shall be no more.

Many kings and princes behold;
Pris'ners leap with redemption song
Of graceful tunes of praise to God.
Whose Kingdom grows with glorious throng.

To Him our Lord we now belong!
'Hallelujah'! arise our song.
The earth shall kiss prosperity;
And poverty shall vanquished be.

JESUS our gracious King and Friend,
Revive us Lord our ways to mend.
And as Thou now has come to reign,
Teach us Lord Thy Way to maintain.

Thy Kingdom O Christ cannot fail
To give peace to those who love Thee.
The pow'r of Satan can't prevail
Over the peace that Thou doth give.

Rejoice, the Lord has come to reign
To save all those who trust in Him!
Strengthen our faith O Lord of grace
That we eternal life obtain.

CHRIST my Refuge and Defence,
Hide me in Thy Court below,
Where Satan cannot harm me,
As Thy Light around me shines.

Good gifts are all from my Lord—
My Mediator and my Friend.
I will now live by His Word,
Trusting e'er in His reward.

O send Thy Spirit Divine
In all my thoughts now to shine;
Guiding me to do Thy Will,
More and more till life I gain.

CHRIST my “Rock” and “Advocate”,
Let me ever trust in Thee.
Though enemies may abide,
And dangers my ways betide.

Protect me Bless-ed Jesus
Thro' the various changing scenes.
Save, O save me my Saviour!
Till I reach the Golden Shore.

On Thee, my Lord, I now stand:
In Thee, my strength is renewed;
From Thee doth flow stream of life,
O Thou Dispenser of life!

Feed, O feed me “Word of life”---
Ever present gracious Lord!
Teach me, teach me, “Word of God”---
Thou “Son of the Bless-ed GOD”!

Jesus Christ our gracious One,
May my sins be forgiv'n me;
And, may my deeds be pleasing
In Thy sight, O Christ the King!

If in divers temptations,
I do not heed Satan's way,
Bless-ed I'll be in that Day,
When a “Crown of life” I'll gain.

For Thy pains on tree we share:
For Thy true Service we care
Christ, our Bless-ed Redeemer.

GOOD Shepherd, Our Lord and Friend
Christ the Saviour of mankind,
Lord, weFr will with Thee abide
In Thy Tabernacle

We will praise Thee, Lord Jesus our King
Tabernacle of GOD with men,
Within our hearts we rejoice, brethren,
Praising the Lord, our God and King

Lord, according to Thy Will,
Our hearts Thou doth always fill
With Thy spirit to guide us,
And make us flee from sins

Lord Jesus, our Bless-ed One!
O feed us Thou Prince of Life
With Thy precious Word of Life
Divine gift from above.

HOPE of our age, Jesus dear!
Star of our hope, dear Redeemer!
O! JEHOVAH'S Tabernacle
Hear us on Thee we call.

Now we do bear Thy yoke with joy:
Now we do hear Thy Loving voice,
Calling us to Salvation way.
Hear us, on Thee we call.

Jesus our King and Saviour dear;
Thou on the tree was slain for us,
Shedding Thy Blood to ransom us.
Hear us, on Thee we call.

Unto Thee we will make our vows;
And pay same with contrite spirit,
And with sacrifices of praise.
Hear us, on Thee we call.

JESUS Christ my Redeemer,
Precious is Thy Fountain
Of healing Water of Life,
Free to all who seek Thee.

Jesus Christ my Saviour
Fount of Living Water.
Quench my thirsty soul, O Lord,
With Thy Living Water.

Jesus Christ my loving friend,
Send Thy Spirit Divine.
May my faith in Thee increase,
Always trusting in Thee.

Lead me to the Blissful Shore---
Land of Peace for ever,
Full of beauties all around,
Glorifying my Lord.

KEEP us Lord safely this day;
Guide us from ill thoughts,
And leave us not in sorrows:
Fill our hearts with joy.

Keep us Lord and leave us not,
Lest we fall in sins.
Sinful though hath been our ways,
Redeem us O Christ.

Kindly lead us by Thy Hand
As pilgrims of hope,
In our joyful pilgrimage
To the Promised Land.

We beseech Thee, Lord of lords
Keep us in Thy care;
Free from woe and free from griefs
Thine to be for'er.

King of Righteousness---gracious Lord;
Send us Thy blessings from Thy Throne.
Gladly we'll live in Thee our Lord,
And ever trust in Thee alone.

What a joy in our Lord!
What a joy in our Lord we have!
What a joy in our Lord!
Since we live by His bounteous grace.

How sincere a Saviour art Thou!
How good are Thy judgements how sure!
And now to Thee our Lord we vow
Thy works to do for ever more.

The blind, the deaf, the lame, shall leap
Now with joy of Thy righteous reign;
For in Thee, our Lord, they shall reap
The goodness of Thy promised “rain”.

Our burdens on Thee we will cast
As pilgrims in a desert land;
For as a Star of Hope Thou art
To guide our Homeward Pilgrimage.

Make our hearts Thy habitation.
Grant, we pray Thee, that we should be
Good patterns of Thy glorious works,
That gentiles Thy glory may see.

LORD give us strength ourselves to control
Never tired the Truth to embrace.
As in this wicked word we dwell a while,
May we labour with faith to seek Thy grace

LORD, give us strength ourselves to control,
That we err not from Thy righteous Way
To serve Thee ever more in Thy Kingdom;
For Thy lovingkindness Thou mainteneth.

As soldiers of our Saviour, Jesus,
May we grow from strength to strength in peace,
That we bring forth fruits meet for repentance
With our hearts full of joy and praise of Christ.

Christ, Thou who acrest for the sinners
Who seek to flee from world’s sinful lusts,
May ever shine amidst us Thy presence
Where two or three in Thy Name are gathered.

title: LORD JESUS, NOW THY HOLY NAME

stanzas.text:
Grant, we pray Thee, Thy bountiful Wisdom.
Thy Spirit guiding us to Thy Kingdom.
Grant us O Lord, Thy Peace and Love divine;
That our thoughts be renewed in Thee to shine.

Grant us Thy Mercy O Christ our Saviour.
Refresh us with Thy precious word of life,
O Jesus---our Wonderful Counsellor,
The 'Horn of Salvation'---the Prince of Life.

LORD Jesus---“Sun of Righteousness”!
Thou Son of Most High God
In Thee we've found an endless peace,
Jesus---Wisdom of GOD.

Let Thy Light illuminate us,
And to make us now shine
Gloriously in Thy works divine
As marvels to the foes.

Christ our Advocate---Word of GOD!
Good Shepherd, guide us Lord!
Thou Captain of our Salvation,
Now grant us redemption.

With joy of Thy presence revealed
As Thy remnant may we
Work in unity Lord, for Thee
To the shame of the foes.

LORD, knit our hearts with love;
Knit them lovely to be,
That we will live in love,
With faith unfeigned in Thee.

Lord, knit our homes with peace;
Knit them peaceful to be,
Dwell in our homes and bless
Us Thy sons by Thy grace.

O Christ, Bless-ed Wisdom!
Give us Thy gracious word,
And knit our hearts to love
Wisdom better than gold.

May I at Thy Throne of Justice
Find sweet solace by Thy precepts
To make me more to keep Thy ways,
As worthy candidate of Christ.

O teach me Lord Thy way of life,
That by Thy grace I may be found
To be a worthy citizen
Of the Beautiful Promised Land.

May my humble supplications
Be acceptable Lord, to Thee,
That Thou may guard and guide my Thoughts
To think of Thy glories always

THY Truth to seek and know of Thee,
Thy Love to have friendly thoughts,
Thy Pow'r to conquer worldly lusts---
These, my Lord, I need from Thee.

Guide me, Lord, in Thy Way,
Lest I wander far away
Bless me, Lord, for ever,
To conquer sin with Thy pow'r.

When once I wandered far from Thee.
When in dev'lish deeds I roved,
I knew not Thou loveth me, Lord,
Till Thy Truth hath made me free.

Thou Ransomer---Jesus my Lord,
Redeemer of the sinners
Who love to be faithful Christians;
Help me Lord, to keep Thy Word.

Jesus, Thou leadeth in the Way
Of righteousness, Truth and Life,
And the midst of paths of judgment,
And blesseth them that love Thee.

I love Thee O my Lord;
And need Thee every hour
To face all my labour
With peace from Thine abode.

I love Thee and I need Thee.
Jesus my Redeemer!
My Wonderful Defender!
Jesus, I need Thee!

In sorrow or in pain,
Jesus I will need Thee,
My Lord, to comfort me.
Let me not trust in vain.

When'er temptations come,
Lord, I love to need Thee.
For, when Thou art near me,
The Foe will ne'er o'ercome.

Lord, I love to need Thee
To fill me with Thy peace;
To guide me never cease,
Through sky, or land, or sea.

Thy presence is my joy,
Lord, in distress or grief,
O, bring me swift relief
May I Thy peace enjoy.

At night or in the day,
Lord, I love to need Thee,
From satan's snares to flee,
I always tread Thy way.

In my heart I do rejoice
Praising Jesus my Saviour;
Marching to the golden shore.
Where my rest is ever sure.

O! in my heart I do rejoice
With cheerful songs of joy and praise;
O! in my heart I do rejoice
Praising Christ for ever-more.

Daily do I now rejoice,
Casting all my cares on Christ;
Trusting in His word of light
That brings everlasting joy.

Though trials and tempest be,
Yet on Christ my hope is built;
Trusting in His precious “Writ”,
That I may be free from guilt.

title: MY LORD, I TRUST IN THEE

stanzas.text:
My Lord, I trust in Thee,
Trusting every hour;
For Thou will protect me
In perilous hour.
Jesus Christ my Saviour:
Thou my Star of Hope.
Guide me Loving Saviour
To Eternity.

Lord Jesus, I love Thee---
Love Thee with my heart.
For Thou didst die for me
On Calvary's mount.
There, Thou didst shed Thy blood
To free me from sins.
Words are full in my heart
To shew forth Thy Praise

Jesus, I do seek Thee
For Thy precious Word.
Daily I thirst for Thee
Dispenser of life.
Into Thy Kingdom Lord,
For Refuge I flee.
Lord Jesus, I've sought Thee:
O, favour me Lord.

O my Bless-ed Saviour---Christ
And belov-ed Redeemer!
What an unceasing joy that
I have found grace in Thy sight.

Unsearchable is Thy love,
More than scenes of worldly love!
May I know Thy ways to love,
With Thy true Spirit of love?

Loved with Thy Infinite Love,
Blessed with wisdom from above,
Thy way of Truth makes me wise,
To pursue the promised prize.

Christ, I'm Thine for ever Thine!
Gifts of thanks to Thee I bring.
In Thy Kingdom I will sing---
'I am Thine and Thou art mine'.

I'll remember Thee, O my Lord, remember Thee
With all my heart, now in Thy Kingdom O GOD
Thou hast been my love, and Thou hast been my joy.
I will always remember Thee, my Lord,
In all I do, and in all I speak or vow.
I'll remember, Jesus To Thee I flee.

Remember Thee, I'll remember Thee my Lord!
I'll always remember Thee, with joy in my heart!
Thou hast been my Love and hast been my Lord,
In God's Kingdom ever more.

I must remember Thee, my Lord, in all I say.
Remember Thee, Lord, and all Thy love to me.
Jesus without Thee, I should have gone astray
In this darkest world of sin and of woe!
In all I think, O! Thy praise shall come to Thee.
I'll praise and glorify my Lord and King.

O, Jesus my Lord, I always remember Thee
This will I do in Thy Kingdom ever more.
O lead me my Lord, now to the golden shore,
Where Thy love and peace shall reign without end.
Thy love I seek, and Thy love I now have found
In all I hear and think and say and do.

JESUS, Thy yoke I have chosen,
In Thy glorious Kingdom to find rest;
And since the world I've forsaken,
Thy yoke is easy to bear.

Jesus my Lord, Saviour Divine!
Send Thy Light and Truth to shine.
To Thee, I've come with thankful praises
To keep Thy precepts with joy.

Lord, Thy burden I have chosen,
Hoping in Thy sure reward and grace.
My godly desire, O bless,
That I may dwell in Thy peace.

Though friends may scorn and may shun me,
Yet, Lord, I'll ever rejoice in Thee,
To do Thy work is my glory,
O Jesus Christ my Saviour!

Lord, to trust in Thy name is life,
Since Thou art the Prince of Peace and life.
Leave me not, O Faithful Saviour!
And Thy yoke I'll bear with joy.

MY heart is fixed on Christ alone---
My Friend and Mediator.
His Trust I'll spread from shore to shore,
And magnify to all His Name.

My tongue His righteousness declares:
And His Wonderful love to me.
Not faithless praise by lips to Him,
But Christian deeds of faithfulness.

Lord, make my heart to understand
Thy Wisdom, Justice, with courage.
O Lord, my Rock and my Refuge,
Speak, and Thee I will understand.

WITH a Christ-like heart of love,
With a merry heart in truth,
Day by day we live to love,
All to serve our Lord with faith.

Christ, teach us Thy way to go,
And Thy foot-prints to follow;
Guiding us to love Thee more,
For Thy presence is our joy.

All is lost if we love not
The Wisdom of God to know:
All is gain if we love not
The ways of sin to follow.

Now the love of our Saviour
With His people here is found;
And a Christ-like heart in Truth.
Make us flee from sinful lusts.

Nowhere could Wisdom be found:
Nowhere could justice be had;
Except in Kingdom of Christ
The desire of mankind.

EVER to be with Christ Jesus my Lord;
My Friend and Shephard, kind Jesus, my Love
An unwavering faith in Him I’ll have,
In His Kingdom here on earth to serve.

Ever with Christ Jesus my Lord,
I’ll live with faith His will to do.
In Paradise my lovely Home;
There shall I dwell by grace for ever more.

Ever to be with Christ Jesus my Love;
Ever to trust Christ Jesus my Hope.
I will dwell with Him, that comes from above
To learn of His precious Word of life.

O, Jesus who died is my loving Friend,
To save those who trust in His precious Word.
Jesus my Star of Hope – Beloved Friend:
Thy spirit, send to dwell in me, Lord.

Now, to the Paradise I march with joy;
Paradise, the Kingdom of GOD on earth.
There, those who hope in Christ Jesus, my Joy,
Shall dwell in love, peaceful rest on earth.

title: SHAMELESS I AM, MY LORD TO OWN

stanzas.text:
SHAMELESS I am, my Lord to own
And to declare His righteousness
His disciple I am by grace,
Now calling sinners home to Him.

Shameless I am, my Lord to own
And His righteous cause to declare.

And though persecutions may come,
Yet, this I know by faith I'll live,
Holding fast His doctrines of life,
Till on the blissful shore I'll reach.

Though strait and narrow is the gate:
Though friends and kinsmen may despise:
Though enemies may try to hate,
By faith in God I'll win the Prize.

AS a wandering bird
Far away from its nest,
I wandered once away from my Lord.
Now, my Lord's loving words
Of Truth, bid me return
To His Kingdom of peace and of rest.

Welcome to me, the loving words of Christ.
A gladsome welcome, welcome from my Lord
Now like a child on His love I rest
And find a refuge in His word.

Now, I'm glad in the Truth
I am safe in the power
Of my Lord, in His Kingdom on earth.
In my heart there is joy,
For He careth for me---
Saving me by His precious Word.

Now in Jesus I trust
And I fear not the foes,
Though around me may be the foes,
Yet, I'll look unto Christ,
The Rock and my Defence,
Singing of the great joy in my heart.

WALKING with Christ I rejoice,
For no peril can harm me.
Satan may try but will fail
Since my hope is built on Christ.

Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Oh! What a Loving Saviour.

On Jesus the Rock I stand:
And the Foe I will not dread.
Come what may! I'll speak the word,
That they who hear might repent.

Saviour of my life---Jesus
I've no other light but Thee;
O! guide me Lord, I pray Thee,
In Thy Kingdom of glory.

WRETCHED was our former state,
Full of sorrows we were,
When we dwelt in worldly lusts;
Roaming in satanic state,
Full of sinful thoughts.

Death and sorrow reigned o'er us,
When we trusted sinful man;
But now is Jesus our friend
For we put our trust in Him,
For safety and help.

May all who now live in Christ
And they who His word do trust,
Bear the standard of His Light.
“'Faithful' is our Redeemer---
Jesus---our dear friend”.

Now will we for ever praise
Christ our Blessed Prince of Peace,
In His Kingdom of glory,
Calling! Calling sinners Home!
To Land of endless.

title: LORD, THROUGH GRACE, I'M IN THY MOUNT

stanzas.text:
LORD, thro' grace, I'm in Thy Mount,
Praising Thee with joyful heart.

GOD of mercy, Saviour dear,
As I Live, Thy Word I'll hear.

Remember me, LORD, for good,
Blessing me with godly works.

Though the world may hate or shun,
Yet, I'll glory in Thy Name.

Wholesome rest and perfect peace,
Nobody can give but Thee.

LORD, thro' Thy grace I shall dwell
In Thy KINGDOM ever more.

title: MY LORD, MY GREAT DESIRE IS

stanzas.text:
MY Lord, my great desire is,
That Thou shouldest guide me daily,
Oh! I love to keep Thy precepts
Lord, grant me Thy grace and peace.

Jesus, my Saviour and King
Thou loveth me dearly,
Since I’ve heard and learnt of Thee,
Let me now Thy praises sing.

O my Lord, may Thy gracious word,
E’er be my meditations.
I will ever trust in Thy Word,
When in divers temptations.

title: BLEST'S THE HOUR WE GATHER IN CHRIST

stanzas.text:
BLEST's the hour we gather in Christ
For then our inmost hearts rejoice.
Blest's the day we conquer trials,
Ever with Jesus now to be.
It is not good brethren for us
To trust carnal things and glory;
But e'er to trust in Jesus Christ,
With spiritual thoughts for His love.

'Follow me I will give thee rest
In yonder bank the promised Home'---
The whisp'ring voice I heard from Christ,
Who loves me dearly as His own.
Here in His Holy Mount of peace,
Will I give my daily service,
With an unfeigned love for Jesus---
My ever present truest friend.

When our bewildered days shall cease,
When in God's earthly Paradise
We shall dwell with smiling faces,
As faithful 'Jonadabs' by grace
Then shall flee ignorance and sins.
No more wailing, no more sorrows,
No more errors and no more pains.
Above all, freed from hands of death.

title: NOW, IN MY EARS I ALWAYS HEAR

stanzas.text:
NOW, in my ears I always hear,
The Masters voice calling me o'er
Yonder bank, where He will give me
The crown of life, He keeps for me.

Like sweet scent from a glorious home,
My heart receives the wondrous Name
Of Christ, calling me to o'er bank,
For crown of life, He keeps for me.

Though compassed by satan's distress,
While on journey to yonder bank;
Yet Jesus---Whom I daily thank,
Will be my Hope and Righteousness.

When in the yonder bank I'll live,
When Satan shall have been destroyed,
The earth my paradise shall be,
Where I'll receive the crown of life.

title: O! FRIENDS AND HOMES WE'VE FORSAKEN

stanzas.text:
O! friends and homes we've forsaken,
While they hate God's word to learn.
To God we've come His Truth to learn,
As life and peace we will gain.
                 Bless us O God!
Loving Father---Gracious LORD.

LORD---the Fountain of Salvation!
When fond ones fail, Thou helpeth!
When our trust in the world faileth,
Thou art our Consolation.
                 O Gracious LORD!
Be Thou ever more our help.

LORD, we will trust in Thee with faith
In this world the vale of death.
Where foes abide, Thou saveth us.
And fill us with joyful songs.
                 Our Defender!
Save us with Thy mighty Arm.

O LORD, bless us, we Thy Children
O bless us with Thy Wisdom!
While we gather here to praise Thee,
May we remember Thy Name.
                 Loving Father!
Bless us O LORD, Thine we are.

title: WHEN SATAN DOTH BESET THY WAYS

stanzas.text:
When Satan doth beset thy ways,
And compass thee with fears always,
The voice of Christ will comfort thee
              Trust me, “Be not afraid”.

When trouble still is raging fast,
When friends and mates will out thee cast,
Christ will call thee with joy and say---
              Trust me, “Be not afraid”.

When thou hath waited in bondage,
And within thy hearts sorrow stage,
The voice of hope will come from Christ---
              Trust me, “Be not afraid”.

Trust me and be not ye weary;
Trust and find rest in my decree,
When temptations beset thy way,
              Trust me, “Be not afraid”.

PILGRIMS of Hope in Christ,
Never be sad.
Though the way may be far,
Never weary.
For Christ our Star of Hope,
Shall lead us safely Home.
To the Kingdom of God,
The Hope of man.

Though fierce may be the foes,
Be not afraid.
Though troubles may abound.
Be not afraid.
Not fearing Satan's snares,
Though dangers may affright,
Yet, trusting in Jesus,
Ye shall conquer.

Though temptations may come,
Hold fast thy faith.
Trusting in Jesus Pow'r,
Ye shall conquer.
Though enemies may be
And trials may abound,
If thou be faithful still,
Ye shall be saved.

title: COURAGE, BRETHREN! AND DO NOT FAINT

stanzas.text:
COURAGE, brethren! And do not faint,
Though Satan thy path may face.
There is faith to guide us,
Since God's will you choose to do.
Though the way be far and narrow,
And the foes may try to hurt,
March on bravely, heroes of Christ,
Since God's Will you choose to do.

Be courageous, brethren in love.
Thou to live in Christ is gain.

Be courageous in the LORD,
Trusting in His boundless grace,
Thou art.

Falsehood and sinful acts forsake,
Godless ways and lust deny,
With hope unwavering in Christ,
Since God's will we choose to do.
Though friends will hate and shun us,
And parents may us deny,
But murmur not, look unto Christ,
Since God's will we choose to do.

SOUND the gospel message
“GOD’S Kingdom now has come”
May hope of peace be had
In all the world around.

The hope of mankind now has come,
Thro’ Jesus Christ our Lord and King.

Our Lord’s second presence
Brings joy to the world
“Salvation now is free”
Through Jesus Christ.

Sith Satan and his flock,
Shall all fall and no more
All they the dust shall lick,
Who shun the Truth.

Hail JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ!
In their time appointed!
GOD thro' Christ, hath been revealed
By His Gospel preached aright.
Christ now reigns with sure redemption:
He's now Captain of Salvation
To set the sinners free from.
And their darkness into light.

In the Kingdom of Christ our King
With Branches all o'er the earth,
The 'sheep' of God are now gath'ring
For sure mercies of the LORD.
And His grace is increasing
In God's strength and riches sure
Sheep of GOD in peace abiding
While the worldlings dwell in strife.

While the tides of time are changing,
And Satan with anger be,
Still our hearts in Christ rejoicing,
E'er in His Kingdom to be.
Now in peaceful joy and gladness
For His blessings in our sight
Must we hail JEHOVAH and Christ
Ever more their own to be.

title: TEACHABLE ARE THE MEEK IN CHRIST
subtitle: (The Beatitudes) Drawn from Matt. 5:3-12

stanzas.text:
TEACHABLE are the meek in Christ
Who tread His way of light;
Bearing the banner of His grace---
“Salvation to mankind”.

Oh! Bless-ed are the poor in heart,
For theirs God's Kingdom is;
Faithfully will they be in peace
With Christ, the 'Word of Light'.

Bless-ed are they who hungereth
And thirst for righteous course;
They shall be filled with word of God
And learn of Him our Lord.

Oh Bless-ed are the merciful:
Mercy shall they obtain.
And bless-ed are the pure in heart,
For they the LORD shall see.

Bless-ed are the makers of peace;
Children of God they're called.
Blest are they who suffer for Christ,
For God's Kingdom is theirs.

Bless-ed are ye when men hate thee,
For the sake of the LORD.
Be glad, rejoice exceedingly,
For crown of life is yours.

ONE Church, One Faith, O! One Hope,
Built on sure Foundation---
Jesus Christ our Redeemer---
Our Mighty Defender.
He came for our redemption.
That we might live in hope,
He chose His 'nointed Christians
Guiding to God our ways.

One Church, One Faith, One Nation,
Peculiar to the world.
One Hope, One sure Foundation
Of 'Israel' of the LORD,
Built on Jesus, Mighty God---
The Rock of Salvation.
His Church-anointed Christians---
One forty-four thousand.

One Church, One New Creation---
The Chosen of our LORD,
Bringing now God's salvation
To faithful ones of God.
“As a grain of mustard seed”,
She grows a mighty tree
With branches in every race,
Shelt'ring 'Eagles' of God.

One Church, One Redemption prize,
Thro' Jesus Christ our Lord,
Who brings Freedom to mankind,
Who loves to know His word.
To Him be glory and praise,
Who eternally reigns
In pow'r, in Justice for all,
Till God be all in all.

THERE is a Way that leads to life,
Where Christians love to go,
Narrow and pleasant is the Way---
The Way of truth and life.

The Way of Truth and Life;
There Christians love to go
Christ is the Way, the Truth and Life
“The Author and Finisher of our Faith”

It leads straight to the Promised Land
For faithful ones in Christ,
Who love to do the will of God,
And heed His Word of Truth.

The Way of Truth and Life and Rest
Has unfailing comfort,
Full of Wisdom, and full of grace.
From God the KING of Kings.

title: THERE IS A LAND OF LIFE

stanzas.text:
THERE is a Land of life without end,
Where righteousness and freedom shall be.
Will you be there in that glorious Land?
Then be faithful in the work of God.

In that Land full of grace,
We shall dwell as faithful ones of God.
Oh! in that Promised Land,
We shall live in robes of righteousness.

Christ our Ransomer bids us repent:
He's now calling for you and for me
To dwell with Him in that Land of Rest,
Where the faithful ones in Him shall live.

There, for a thousand years Christ shall reign
Building glorious earth---the 'Paradise'
In the “Resurrection Day” will rise
The just and the unjust ones from grave.

Righteous ones shall have eternal life,
As princes and princesses they'll live.
Unjust ones from the grave shall be judged
And punished according to their sins.

Oh! When the thousand years are ended,
Satan shall from the grave be loosened
To see the glorious earth---“Paradise”
He'll not repent but try to deceive.

But from Heaven the anger of God
Will completely destroy him for e'er,
Christ shall hand o'er the Kingdom to God
And JEHOVAH shall be all in all

FAR away in Mountain Zion,
Are belov-ed Saints of GOD;
Rejoicing and reigning with Christ,
Who is crowned to reign for’er.
The Angels sing, “Hallelujah”!;
Hailing Jehovah and Christ.
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Christ now reigns eternally.

Now, the Saints and Angels of GOD,
Rejoice in Mountain Zion,
All the meek in Christ our Saviour,
Rejoice on the earth below.
LORD, how glorious is Thy Kingdom,
In heaven and earth below!
Perfect peace and wisdom abound,
For Thy favoured ones O LORD.

‘Ancient worthies who now do sleep,
Will live on that glorious land.
By faith they foreknew its glories,
Though unseen with human eyes.
Since they died with hope of living,
Ever more in its glories,
They shall arise and reign in peace,
With faithful Christians on earth.

“AFTER this I beheld a great multitude
Which no man could number of all the nations
Before the Throne of the Lamb they stood
And with a loud voice cried---
'Salvation to our God'!

Cloth-ed with white robes and palms in their hands!
These are they which came out of the Great Tribulation.
And have washed their robes, made them white.
In the blood of the Lamb.

A song of hope, we love to sing,
As the days pass away,
And Kingdom news brings brightest 'ray'
To elects of the KING.
Serve the LORD with a willing heart:
Spend for the LORD thy days,
Though friends and kindreds may depart,
Yet GOD wont forsake Thee.

O sing the Song of Hope!
O sing the song with joy!
Now serve the LORD, O serve with hope
To gain a “Crown of Life”.

Just a moment! Ye godless ones!
Hear the gospel of Christ!
Repent! Lest ye be found astray
From God's protecting Hand.
Now join Jehovah's glorious band,
Lest by the “Sword” ye fall;
And lose thy life---thy precious life!
‘For GOD has spoken it’.

With thanksgiving in faith and praise,---
Hold fast with hope thy crown,
Never yielding to godless ways,
That lead to destruction.
Let's spread abroad the Kingdom news
And give to God our dues.
That they who hear may now rejoice---
Singing the song of Hope.

title: AWAKE, ARISE YE YOUTHS OF CHRIST

stanzas.text:
AWAKE, arise ye youths of Christ!
Shew forth your Saviour's praise.
The hour has come for us to raise
The wondrous works of Christ!

Jesus our Saviour now has come---
His faithful ones to lead.
We dwell with strength in Him indeed
Our ill ways to reform.

With a loving voice He calls thee
Now in His reign to join.
His strength will ever bear thee on
Aren't you His Own to be

Are you willing His work to do?
Then gird your armour on,
And labour till the task is done,
For thine shall be His “dew”.

Christ in Thy Name we do rejoice,
For joy of our Vict'ry
O'er counterfeit prophets who flee
As they hear Thy great voice.

O Gracious God, what'er we bring
As thanksgiving this day,
May they be good for Thee-our “Way”
Thou art our Lord and King.

title: FLEE INTO THE KINGDOM OF GOD

stanzas.text:
Flee into the Kingdom of God!
Sing praises of Him who was slain,
Shedding His precious blood, O! to redeem us
O sing His praise with thanks!
He has come to reign
In pow’r, and love and peace
Give Him your hearts!

O give Him your hearts! Do, brethren in Christ.
O give Him your hands! brothers and sisters.
He has come to set His Kingdom here on earth:
To set the captives free.
Now sing praises of Christ our King,
Who reigns eternally in pow’r.

Behold Him at your door knocking
With love’s redeeming work of grace!
And saying, “May I come in to dwell, sinners,
To make you free indeed?”
“Ye shall know the Truth,
And the Truth shall make you free”!
Give Him your hearts!

When Land of Salem ye shall reach,
There, no more grief, nor death abides;
But joyful peace and love of Christ all around.
And everlasting life,
How glorious the Land
Of Salem - The Paradise!
With joy around.

MANY thirsty ones are seeking,
Seeking for the Kingdom News:
And they are all weary waiting,
For the mil'tant Christian band:
Many thirsty ones are seeking,
Seeking for the Kingdom News.

For earth's numerous sinful lures,
Shall we bow and fail to go?
For worldly abiding pleasures,
Shall we err to please the foe?
Never brethren yield to Satan:
‘rise and gird your amour on'

O! Nations and kindreds of men,
Now hear of Christ's peaceful reign;
Joyfully are they responding,
Thirsty ones to Christ being won.
O, joyfully! O, joyfully!
With the Truth---God's two-edged sword.

Hear the mil'tant Christian voices
Sounding the Kingdom tidings---
The glad news of freedom for all:
For lost souls returning Home.
Kingdom tidings, Kingdom tidings---
Healing balm to suff'ring souls.

title: OH! SING THE KINGDOM JOYFUL NEWS

stanzas.text:
OH! Sing the Kingdom joyful news
Of salvation free to all.
Declare to nations far and wide,
Of the Salvation news.

Salvation to mankind!
O Salvation is free!
Through Jesus Christ our Saviour
Who reigns for ever more.

O ye pris'ners of hope rejoice;
Behold the presence of Christ!
Sing joyful songs to Him our King,
For he will make you free.

With united voice sing with joy
Of our Saviour's gracious love.
For His presence shall make you free
With blessings from above.

REJOICE children of GOD by faith:
Give thanks and praise the LORD.
Your voices lift with glorious sound,
The KING of kings to praise.

Now rejoice, ye children of grace
That His Kingdom has come.
In His Mount of Holiness live
And love to do His Will.

Proclaim our Saviour's reign to all:
Tread where His feet have trod.
As children of our Heav'nly KING,
Let's serve and Him adore.

title: YE CHILDREN OF OUR HEAVENLY KING

stanzas.text:
YE children of our Heavenly King,
Proclaim the Gospel of peace to mankind
JEHOVAH'S Kingdom spreads from shore to shore.
Till all the nations know JEHOVAH GOD.

Go onward with the Gospel!
Of peace to all the world!
And declare the Gospel of peace
To all mankind.

Now many tongues and kindreds shall hear
This Kingdom message of Jesus with mirth,
Through all His chosen christians here on earth,
Who proclaim this gospel of peace for'er.

Safe in the Arms of JEHOVAH GOD,
The Kingdom news flows over thirsty lands,
Redeeming sinners thro' Christ's precious Word
The healing water to the fainting ones.

title: WHO IS ON THE LORD'S SIDE

stanzas.text:
Who is on the LORD's side,
And will worship Him?
Who will be His solders,
Many souls to win?
Let him shun the world's side,
As heroes of Christ;
Winning souls to Jesus,
With armour of Light.

For JEHOVAH's Service,
In His Truth divine,
We are now His soldiers,
Winning souls to Him.

Though the Way be dreary,
While the foes array,
Yet, by Jesus' Power
We tread without fear.
As mighty conquerors,
March we faithfully
Till the foes be vanquished,
Thro' Jesus our Lord.

Jesus Christ our Saviour.
Thou can make us free,
Our hope is built on Thee.
Thine alone we are.
With this hope of freedom,
Go we in Thy name
Joyfully and boldly,
With songs of Vict'ry.

As Kings and governors
Shall reign the sons of God,
Who publish good tidings of peace,
And Salvation of God.

With cheerful voices sweet
In unison of praise,
We declare the Kingdom tidings
That 'Christ has come to reign'!

Not caring, not fearing
The fowler's flaming darts,
We publish with boldness the Truth
While the foes flee with shame.

Precepts upon precepts,
Here and there a little,
We search God's word from page to page,
From Bible---book divine.

As people of the Saints,
Gather we on God's Mount
From day to day to do service
And praise the King of kings.

LET us work, O brethren!
Ye people of the Lord!
The good works of our God
That give peace to the mind:
And as faithful children
Bought by Christ's precious blood,
Let us do the good works
Of Jesus Christ our Lord.

Let us work, let us hope!
Let us sing, and rejoice!
Let us work in the LORD!
Till we reach Promised Land.

Remember now the LORD
In the days of thy youth;
And to do with thy strength
The good works of the LORD
O! Without fainting heart,
While evil days come not,
And without murm'ring voice,
Let us work and rejoice.

Brethren, with joyful hearts
And faithfulness in GOD
And Jesus---Prince of Peace
Let us work and rejoice
For Christ has come to reign,
Vanquishing the cohort
Of godless ones---the foes,
And blessing us His own.

Let us work, let us hope!
Minding not Satan's snares;
But trusting in the LORD,
Till the labour is o'er
Then on that Freedom Shore,
We shall reign with the LORD,
For our reward is sure
Eternal life and rest.

title: MAN, WHATEVER THY THOUGHTS MAY BE

stanzas.text:
MAN! Whatever thy thoughts may be,
Oh! forget not JEHOVAH GOD!
For he hath out of dust formed thee,
In His own likeness and image.

Man! Amend thy ways in the Lord
Believing in His word of life.
For thou, in the days long gone bye,
Was without JEHOVAH our GOD.

Now, as the world is full of woes,
Oh! without God, what hope has man?
Our hope is Christ the “Son of Man.”
And His glorious Kingdom on earth.

“Kiss the Son, lest angry He'll be
And ye soon perish from the Way
His Kingdom He has promised Thee,
Where Life abundant is for e'er.

Though sins about me beset from babe,
Right from mother's womb in her grief;
May they be forgiven me, LORD,
Since Thy Truth O Lord, I heed with joy.

Though Satan with dangerous snares,
My soul he doth with grief compass;
Yet, by continuance faith in God,
He guides me now safely thro' them all.

Of myself nothing can I do:
Timid, weak and helpless I am:
Yet, in Thee JEHOVAH I trust,
Journeying thro' this dark world of sin.

God my courage! Thou art my Vict'ry!
Full of wholesome blessings from above.
Fill my heart with Thy wholesome words
A shield against all unwholesome lusts.

title: COME TO JESUS YE WEARY ONES

stanzas.text:
COME to Jesus ye weary ones!
And He shall give thee rest.
And with implicit faith in Him,
Ye shall not run in vain.

COME to Jesus ye weary ones!
And He shall give thee rest.
And with implicit faith in Him,
Ye shall not run in vain.

Come to Jesus ye slumb'ring ones!
Awake with songs of praise!
Sing it with hope and endless joy
To Christ our Redeemer.

Prayerfully and thankfully,
To Jesus Christ come ye
Now His redeeming grace to seek
Which none other can give.

title: MAN OF GOD, O FLEE FROM SINS

stanzas.text:
MAN of GOD! O flee from sins!
Follow after righteous course;
Lay hold on eternal life
With faith and with godliness,
O! Fight the good fight of faith,
Whereunto thou now art called.

Professing the love of Christ
With patience and endurance,
Lay up a good foundation;
That thou may lay hold on life
Everlasting by God's grace,
On the shore of Salvation.

Think not of the worldly lusts:
Think not of its temp'ral joy,
They may seem a glossy way,
Yet, to destruction they lead.
Man of God! O flee from sins!
And walk in Christ-way of life.

Brethren herald joyful anthem of praise!
Hail the LORD! Salvation is free!
And the glory of God of peace e'er raise
For sure salvation and vict'ry

Onward go with the Saviour's conq'ring pow'r:
Onward march till the Lord's Will we've done;
Put the breastplate of faith and pray'r
Till the Foe and his hosts be o'er thrown.

Be strong in the Lord: in great Might He dwells;
Boldly stand for Truth and His call.
Never shall we cease, while bless'd anthem swells—
“Christ the King now reigns over all”!

Fight on while the Foe is unconquered yet:
No laying of the armour down:
No fainting till battle's 'vantage we get
And Vict'ry wins for us Life's crown.

title: BRETHREN, THERE'S BRIGHT AND GLORIOUS PLACE

stanzas.text:
Brethren, there's bright and glorious place---
A bless-ed Home of joy and peace.
The just in Christ from all the race,
Shall dwell in perfect love and peace.

From all nations of earth they come
To gather round the Son to kiss,
On that bright shore free from life's storm
There's joy in perfect love and peace

That Bless-ed Home---the joyous earth
Shall live the faithful ones in peace
They sing aloud with faith and mirth
Ever in perfect love and peace.

title: I WAS GLAD WHEN THEY SAID
subtitle: (Drawn from Psalm 122)

stanzas.text:
“I was glad when to me they said,
Let us go to the house of God.
Our feet within thy gates shall stand
Bless-ed City---Jerusalem”.

“I was glad when to me they said;
Let us go to the House of GOD”.

Thither, all the kindreds shall go
That seek to know JEHOVAH GOD.
Such the 'Israel' of GOD shall be,
Giving thanks and praises to GOD

Pray for peace of Jerusalem---
The Mount of God---land of Salem.
May they that love her now prosper,
With riches divine from above.

LORD, in abundance may blessings
Be showered from Thy glorious Throne.
May peace and prosperity be
In Thy gates New Jerusalem.

title: O LAND OF SALEM, OUR BLISSFUL LAND

stanzas.text:
O Land of Salem our blissful Land
On earth---the Paradise!
Lord, guide our steps onward to that Land,
Where prosperity lies.

Land of Salem our joy!
The Paradise on earth!
O lead us, Lord, to the glorious land---
Land of Salem, the Paradise.

O Land of Salem, where sorrows cease
There, Christ Jesus doth reign.
We'll sing her glories our Lord to please
In that fairer “Eden”.

O Jesus our Lord, the Lamb once slain!
Thou, whose love fadeth not;
We pray Thee, Lord keep us to remain
That glorious Land to see.

title: ONCE FROM OUR GOD WE WANDERED FAR

stanzas.text:
ONCE from our God we wandered far;
We were without His love and care.
Thanks be to Christ who redeemed us,
Calling us to beautiful shore.

O happy days when Truth we heard!
For Satan's chains were then loosened
Thro' GOD's Anointed Saints on earth,
Calling us to beautiful shore.

O! Wondrous grace from God above,
Thro' Christ our Redeemer and Friend,
Who died for us on Calvary,
Redeeming with His precious blood.

WHEN earthly sorrows are vanquished.
O LORD our Strength!
In signs of love and peace,
Our joy and rest and love and hope,
Radiant with smiles
In New Jerusalem.

Signs of wretchedness, signs of war
Shall be no more
In New Jerusalem
Heav’n and earth shall kiss with joy,
The signs of peace
In promised blissful Shore.

Then, wolf and leopard and wild beasts
No more shall harm
In New Jerusalem,
Babe and lion shall dwell in peace,
With each other
In New Jerusalem.

They shall not hurt nor shall destroy
In Holy Mount---
The Kingdom of our GOD
Then, no more sorrow shall be heard,
No more bondage,
But freedom everywhere.

And, there in New Jerusalem
Shall be no death
Amongst the ones redeemed
Thro' “great day” of tribulation;
But 'ternal life
In New Jerusalem.

O bless-ed New Jerusalem!
My glorious Home!
And ever-shining shore!
I love to think of Thee, my Home,
My rest, my Joy
O New Jerusalem!

title: LEAD ME TO THY HOLY MOUNTAIN

stanzas.text:
LEAD me to Thy Holy Mountain:
I love to stay.
Where no sorrow nor grief is found
But peace and joy
Lead me, O my Lord
To Thy Kingdom
Where I shall fine rest
In Thee alone.

LEAD me to Thy Holy Mountain:
I love to stay.
Where no sorrow nor grief is found
But peace and joy
Lead me, O my Lord
To Thy Kingdom
Where I shall fine rest
In Thee alone.

Lord, I shall live in Thy glory,
Thee to behold.
Oh! In the New Jerusalem
The Paradise,
Where life abundant
And Truth abound,
Lead me, O lead me,
Jesus my Lord!

Beautiful Land of Promise;
Wonderful Land of Wisdom
Is the Kingdom of the LORD,
Full of love and justice

Salem Land ..... my Love!
I love thee with my heart........
O indeed!
