The Wonderful Land of Wisdom,
Full of Beauties around!
My ever-shining Home:
The Promised Land of God!
O, I love Thee indeed,
My ever-shining Home:

My glorious Land of freedom,
For the "Israel" of the LORD!
I wonder how I love Thee ---
Wonderful Land of GOD!

My heart is full of gladness,
Thy Beauties seeking to know
Back shall I n'er turn from Thee,
But to love Thee always.

title: BE YE SUBJECT TO HIGHER POWERS

stanzas.text:
BE ye subject unto the Higher Pow'rs!
And be submissive to God's ordained pow'rs
Resistance to the ordinance of GOD
Is fighting against the Higher Pow'rs.

Be subject to Higher Powers
And the powers ordained of GOD
Be ye sober and submissive,
For the end of all things is now at hand.

Render therefore to the powers their dues!
For the LORD's sake, be ye subject to them
Pay ye tribute to whom tribute is due;
And be afraid of all evil works.

For Rulers are not terror to good works,
But are terrors to evil works of sins.
Do that which is good and thou shalt have
For to the LORD they are ministers.

Owe no man anything; but be in love.
Love works no evil to his neighbour;
Therefore, love is fulfilling of the law
When thou loveth God and thy neighbour.

Not with envious mind, not in adultery:
And not in rioting and drunkenness,
Let us therefore cast off works of darkness,
And put on the armour of glory.

The night is far spent: the day is at hand,
Make not provision for lusts of the flesh,
For now is our salvation nearer us.
Wake therefore out of sleep and arise!

Thro' man's disobedience, he left
The way of life God gave to him,
When he untimely ate the fruit
In the LORD's garden of Eden.

By that disobedience came death
On that entire human race
Now by the obedience of Christ,
Shall live all they who trust in Him.

O, the wages of sin is death!
Eternal life is gift of GOD!
Thro' our Ransomer---Jesus Christ,
Who shed His blood to save mankind.

In cloak of sin for daily bread,
Ah! In painful labour we toil
To till the soil and grow our food,
In continuous sorrow and pains.

Now, the day is fast approaching
When we'll labour no more in pain;
Then we shall with joy on that day
Praise JEHOVAH with freedom songs.

GOD shall keep us, and He shall lead us.
O what a joy to trace His course!
And when we shall be gathered brethren,
On that golden shore as God's children.
O, what a love and what a joy!

Love, rest and joy and peaceful Home
GOD shall wipe away all tears from our eyes

We are the happy brethren in Christ
O, what a love to dwell in Light!
With faith, joy, love and thankful voices.
We've come to Jesus Christ with praises.
Give Him your hearts! Give Him your hands!

Now, if your hearts delight in the LORD
Give Him your hearts with one accord!
And whenever brethren we gather,
O, what a joy to dwell together!
Give GOD your hearts! Give Him your hands!

To the children of GOD, salvation:
O, what a joy to God's nation!
JEHOVAH, the Almighty Father
Shall keep us and be our Deliv'rer,
In our journey to golden Shore.

KING of kings---Eternal Father;
How precious is the solemn hour,
When in Thy Kingdom we gather,
Singing joyful praises for'er.

When yonder bank our Home shall be;
There, satan and his works shan't be.
What joyful news with richest dews
Shall the earth be with Thy glories!

No words can tell what blessings sure
On that beautiful Salem Shore,
Where sin nor death shall be no more;
But freedom and peace everywhere.

We ought to pray for mercies sure
From the LORD our gracious Father;
That we, by grace of JEHOVAH,
May dwell on that beautiful shore.

title: A SONG OF LOVE WE SING

stanzas.text:
A song of love we sing
In tune that God is Love,
Fills us with joy;
Now with unshaken hearts
And doubts and errors flee
In God's Kingdom we dwell
Faithf'ly in Him.

In sweetest voice of praise
Proclaiming God is Love,
His Name we raise
Always too wonderful,
So precious and peaceful,
Marvellous in our eyes.
Are all His ways.

Ours to tell of His Love;
Ours to shew forth His praise,
In joy or grief.
No worldly thought of ours,
But godly thought in Thee,
Could make us free indeed,
O God of Love!

Keep us Thou God of Love:
Help us in Thy Kingdom
To be Thine own.
Bless us with Thy Wisdom,
And with Thy love divine,
Help us to be thine own,
O GOD of love!

IN Thy Tabernacle O LORD!
Who shall dwell therein?
He that walketh uprightly
In the LORD.

He that speaketh truth in his heart,
And backbiteth not:
Nor do evil to his neighbour
In the LORD.

He that worketh in righteousness
In the Mount of God;
That honoureth them that fear
In the LORD.

He that sweareth to his own hurt,
And he changeth not;
That giveth not out to us'ry
In the LORD.

title: SING A JOYFUL SONG TO JEHOVAH

stanzas.text:
“SING a joyful song to JEHOVAH,
Ye people on the land and seas!
From day to day serve Him for ever,
And in His court sing with gladness.”

“Know ye also, the LORD is Gracious:
He made us and not we ourselves;
And we are the sheep of His pasture.
With thanksgivings enter His gates.”

“The LORD is good; His grace He giveth
Thro' Christ, to His people with faith.
And His mercy is everlasting.
His truth for ever more liveth.”

“O sing aloud to GOD our Saviour,
Sing a joyful song unto Him!
Be ye thankful unto Him, brethren,
And bless Him that giveth us strength.”

“Ye ministers of His by favour,
That serve in His Kingdom always:
Ye people that worship in His courts
Sing joyful songs to GOD for'er.

title: HOW SWEET TO DWELL IN CHRIST

stanzas.text:
HOW sweet it is to dwell in Christ,
For those who love to learn the truth.
Brethren, we've come to love His ways---
To dwell in Christ the Prince of Peace.

What a life we have in Christ
To dwell in Him---the Prince of Peace!
The Perfect and Glorious Prince,
Who for ever and ever reigns.

There is a home of perfect love,
Where Christ everlastingly dwells;
For those who love to dwell in Him
Shall find eternal rest in Him.

The Kingdom of our God has come
To make us free and to bless us.
And now, Jesus our Saviour reigns
In the Kingdom of God of Peace.

When we shall reach the Promised Land.
There we shall dwell in perfect peace---
The peace that none beside our God
Can give those who survive by grace.

title: FATHER, MAY WE DO THY WILL

stanzas.text:
FATHER, may we do Thy will?
Thy lovingkindness we feel,
And Thy precepts we fulfil;
We pray Thee, Father, hear us.

Christ the Way, the Truth, and Life,
Teach us Lord, to live aright.
Knowing Thee, is life in sight;
We pray Thee, Father, hear us.

Jesus give us Thy Wisdom,
That we'll dwell in Thy Kingdom
In peace, and to have freedom;
We pray Thee, Father, hear us.

title: AS PILGRIMS IN A SINFUL WORLD

stanzas.text:
AS pilgrims in a sinful world
On pilgrimage to “Paradise,”
May “Onward march” be our watchword,
Rememb'ring the fall of Lot's wife.

And though as strangers we sojourn
Here in this wicked world of sin,
Yet, we shall, if we trust in GOD,
Find sweet rest in the Promised Land.

When once in godless state we roved,
Sin and grief prevailed o'er our will.
Our hearts were filled with sinful will,
And knew not then God's loving will.

Thanks! For our Lord's second presence,
Which His precious Truth has revealed.
What joyful news this brings to us,
Who love to do the will of GOD.

May His Spirit within us shine
As in His holy Mount we dwell.
May we sing from His Book divine---
LORD for ever more we are Thine!

GIVE thanks and praise JEHOVAH Our LORD and KING,
For the beauty of His Holiness And Holy Word.
Praise and sing hosanna to the Mighty Prince of Peace;
He has come to judge in equity.

Welcome our belov-ed King and Friend---To judge the world in equity!
Where two or three are gathered In Thy Name in Truth,
There is hope of life and peace And rest and joy.

This is a Gospel Message to this Wicked world,
Where there is no hope of life and peace, Nor Truth of God.
Had JEHOVAH not left unto us A small remnant,
We should have all then been destroyed.

title: TEACH ME THE GOSPEL OF JESUS

stanzas.text:
TEACH me the Gospel of Jesus,
I love to hear
How He would redeem me from sins,
I love to know.
When from sins I flee,
Happy I am:
For life I will gain.
Teach me His Ways!

Oh! Words of life in His Kingdom
I Love to hear.
Oh! let me hear how He loves me
And died for me.
Words of salvation,
Deeds full of faith,
Now bring redemption
And peace to all.

Hear Him ye belov-ed brethren,
Faithful in Him.
Casting all your cares upon Him,
He cares for Thee.
Words full of Wisdom
Teach us O Lord!
And send Thy Spirit
To dwell in us.

TRIUMPHANT voices of Salem!
Joyful voices of our King!
Oh! the praises of the Lord, sing
To the earth’s remotest bound!

O sing praises of the Lord,
Who now reigns for evermore!
O sing of Him who once was dead,
And now lives to reign in pow'r!

Loving ones in Jubilation!
Let us sing with thanksgiving
To the Lord of our Salvation,
In this day of rejoicing.

God of Wisdom! God of Power!
Thou art Justice! Thou art Love!
Open now our eyes to behold
Wondrous things out of Thy Law.

SECURELY now in Jesus' care,
The danger will I not fear;
And feeding on His precious Word,
I get with ease my daily bread.
And trusting Him as my Saviour
Who for me on tree shed His blood;
I vow to do His Work for'er,
Living securely in His care.

With hope to enjoy life and peace
Abundantly ever more,
I love my Lord who dearly loves
Me and gave His life to save me.
I love Him not with lying lips;
But with lips full of truth and praise,
And faith unfeigned in all His works;
Thus I'm His child in Truth by grace.

Day by day I do love my Lord:
I, in His Word of life grow,
That I will be a Christian true,
Winning sinners to know my Lord.
In Thy Kingdom I can afford
To Thee my life and all I give.
These all I do in faithfulness
That I may live in Promised Land.

title: GOD IS LOVE; LET US ALL UNITE

stanzas.text:
GOD is Love; let us all unite
And His Name always to praise;
For Christ our Redeemer has come:
Let us all rejoice and sing.

GOD is Love; Let us all rejoice in Him;
And come with praise and thanks to Him.
O let us always praise His Name
And rejoice that GOD is Love

Let us unite His Word to raise
And His Holy Name to praise;
Without sorrow is His blessing
Let us all rejoice and sing.

GOD's Wisdom is so good and dear:
More precious than the rubies.
By His Wisdom good things are made.
Let us all rejoice and sing.

title: SWEET IS THE HOME WHERE LOVE DOTH REIGN

stanzas.text:
Sweet is the home where love doth reign,
And inspires the heart to love
The Truth of Jesus from above---
Who died to save us from sin.

And if our homes be lacking love:
If our deeds be far from love:
If our thoughts be without Christ's love.
Satan seeks therein to dwell.

O! Where the love of Jesus reigns,
In the homes where He abides,
And where few in Truth dwell in Him
Satan will tremble and fear.

NEVER yield to temptations,
It is sinful so to do.
Resistance you should have
To conquer Satan's snares.
With unwavering faith fight;
Fight till the foes retreat.
And ever trusting in Jesus Pow'r
Till Vict'ry is secured.

Never be dismayed, never yield to sin.
Resistance you should have
To conquer Satan's snares.
Fight till the battle be o’er
And trusting in the LORD,
Shall ye be saved,
From this wicked sinful world.

Now embrace the Truth and live!
Now engrave it in your hearts
To flee from sinful lusts,
With hearts more firmly in Truth.
Though may come temptations.
And troubles may assail;
Be faithful, and trusting in the LORD!
Temptations shan't prevail.

title: GOD MADE MAN FROM THE DUST
subtitle: (The Mortality of the Soul)

stanzas.text:
GOD made man from the dust,
And gave him breath of life;
And man became a living soul---
A wonderful creature.

Brethren, all living souls
Are indeed mortal souls;
And none can deliver himself
From the hands of the grave.

For the wages of sin
Is death and vanity;
Eternal life is gift of GOD,
Thro' Jesus Christ our Lord.

The nobles and the kings,
Princes and princesses
Shall have their portion in the grave,
With the poor and oppressed.

“For all the souls are mine”
Saith GOD our Creator.
“The soul that sinneth it shall die”,
Small and great, rich and poor.

On Resurrection Day,
All the dead shall arise,
Unjust for judgement, just for life,
Saith Jehovah of hosts.

title: AH! COULD WE COUNT GOD'S BOUNTEOUS GIFTS

stanzas.text:
AH! Could we count GOD's bounteous gifts
Which he bestowed upon us?
Could we say of His bounteous grace
For His ransomed ones in Christ?
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
What a bountiful favour!

Songs of thanks to GOD be rendered
For His precious gift of life.
Onward Christians! Onward spread
The Kingdom Gospel to all.
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Let our songs to GOD arise.

O! When that glorious Day shall come
Righteousness shall kiss the earth.
No more war, nor death shall be;
But peace and Life everywhere.
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
O, Wonderful Blessed Day!

title: IF WITH TONGUES OF MEN WE SPEAK
subtitle: (Charity, Drawn from 1 Cor. 13 etc.)

stanzas.text:
IF with tongues of men we speak
Or like the angels we speak,
And we have not charity,
We've become a sounding brass
Or a tinkling cymbal's noise.
Or like empty vessel's sound.

Though we've gifts of prophecies,
Though we've understanding hearts,
Of God's knowledge and mysteries,
And we have not charity,
We're nothing but vanity,
And an empty vessel's sound.

And though with faith we remove
All impossibilities,
And though our goods we bestow
To the poor and needy ones,
And we have not charity,
It profiteth us nothing.

Though there be tongues, they shall fail.
Whether there be prophecies,
Charity excelleth all.
Charity never faileth.
Charity ne'er vanquisheth;
But rejoiceth in the Truth.

Now abideth faith, and hope,
And charity; yet of these,
The greatest is charity.
Charity edifieth,
And charity forgiveth.
'Tis the end of all the laws.

'Brethren let's have charity
Fervently amongst ourselves;
For charity covereth
All the multitude of sins.
And be ye therefore sober,
For end of all thing is near'.

title: LORD, GIVE US THY WILLING ONES

stanzas.text:
LORD, give us Thy willing ones
Thy precious rich promises.
May we in Truth always be,
Fitting vessels for Thy praise.

Good Lord, bless us
And give us Lord Thy spirit of peace
While we delight in Thy ways
To glorify Thee always.

O Lord, bless us in Thy Kingdom,
Which has grown as “mustard seed”;
And will soon spread o'er the world,
After “great tribulation”.

Bless the rulers in thy Kingdom,
Guide aright O Lord their ways;
May we be subject to them
In good works and faithfulness.

Gracious LORD, Thou “Ancient of days”
Grant us O LORD our requests,
That we use them to Thy praise,
LORD, in Thy Kingdom always.

title: WHERE COULD WISDOM NOW BE FOUND
subtitle: (Drawn from Job 28:12-21, 23, 28, etc.)

stanzas.text:
WHERE could Wisdom now be found?
And place of Understanding?
Seeing 'tis hidden from men,
Who seek not the Lord our King.
Only God knoweth the Way,
Since 'tis found only in Him.

Depth of Wisdom is in God;
May always our hearts be found
Full of the Wisdom from Him,
Whose Wisdom perisheth not,
But is full of knowledge true
Of salvation to mankind.

The exchange of it can't be
With precious gold and jewels,
Nor glorious corals and pearls;
Because the price of Wisdom
Is above all the rubies.
Therefore, seek Wisdom and live.

Not the wisdom of this world;
Nor its understanding too,
For it beareth war and strife.
Since 'tis foolishness to God,
Enter not its gates thereof,
But seek the Wisdom of GOD.

Behold, the fear of the LORD,
That is to have His Wisdom:
And to flee from evil ways
Is to have understanding,
That thou will gain life and peace
In the Kingdom of our LORD.

title: THERE IS A BOOK I LOVE TO READ
subtitle: (The Holy Bible - Precious Gift)

stanzas.text:
THERE is a Book I love to read,
Where Life and Peace of GOD are found.
There's Word of joy---the Word of GOD,
Which will sweeten a bitter heart.

The poor and meek but rich in Christ,
Find this Book a Treasure of Light.
From page to page its precious words,
Make glad the heart that once was sad.

This book doth shine from age to age,
And shining through the darkest age,
A Writ divine for all the sage:
The Holy Bible---Precious Gift.

The Bible, word of GOD contains;
The human race e'er it maintains.
To those who through its pages run,
Will find comfort and peace therefrom.

title: HERE A LITTLE, THERE A LITTLE

stanzas.text:
HERE a little, there a little -
Searching God's Word of life.
Oh! a little with hope of life
Will find you a sweet relief.
Words of Wisdom - precious Words from GOD
Is the Bible - Book Divine.
A sweet relief from pain and grief -
God's precious Word of life.

Here a little, there a little -
Words of Wisdom, precious Words
of peace and gladness
From the Bible - Word of God.

Here a little, there a little -
The loving Words from God.
O gracious Words of love from God
Bring salvation to mankind!
O salvation to mankind is free
Thro’ Jesus Christ our Lord.
God’s Holy Word shall make us free,
And free we’ll be indeed.

SING forth and praise JEHOVAH,
For the Vict'ry in the Kingdom of our GOD
O there is vict'ry in the Kingdom of our
GOD!
Sing forth and praise JEHOVAH, our GOD
and KING.

Brothers and sisters, be glad,
For the Victory is the LORD'S.
O, for the Victory is the LORD'S!
Rejoice and praise the LORD,
For the Victory is the LORD'S.

Give thanks and praise JEHOVAH!
Hallelujah! For our vict'ry o'er the foes,
Make known God's Vict'ry now to the nations afar;
And warn them to be godly and fear the LORD.

Now sing and renew thy vows;
And proclaim God's Lovingkindness and Victory.
Sing with strength to renew thy vows in His Service
Hailing JEHOVAH and Christ, for our vict'ry.

SING the Song of Vict'ry!
Sing the Song of joy!
With wonderful thoughts of love and Peace
In Jesus our Saviour---
Mighty Prince of Peace
Ruling in the midst of enemies.

Hallelujah! What a Mighty Prince,
Ruling now in Power and Love and Peace.
Sing the Song of Victory! Sing it o'er again,
Heralding the Kingdom tidings free.

Sing the Song of Wisdom
Of our Living GOD!
'Tis the music of the Youths in Christ,
Bearing forth the Anthem---
“There is joy today”.
Tell the joyous tidings of the Truth.

Marching Victoriously
To the battle front,
With the Word of GOD the two-edged sword.
Swing it forth in glory.
Swing it forth with joy,
Piercing through the hearts of sinful men.

Welcome from the battle
Of the LORD of Hosts,
Where the godless flee with shamefulness.
Sing the Song of Vict'ry!
Sing it o'er again!
Proclaiming the Vict'ry of the LORD.

BLESS-ED is the nation,
Whose GOD is JEHOVAH---
JEHOVAH the Creator
Of heaven and earth.
He is the King of kings.
Such nations shall enjoy freedom---
Which is the desire of all mankind.
Bless-ed Freedom! Glorious Freedom---
The desire of mankind!
Peaceful Freedom! Joyful Freedom,
In the Kingdom of our GOD.

All people of the world
Should rejoice in the LORD!
For Freedom in the Kingdom of our GOD
Is the Freedom of great joy.

Bless-ed is the nation,
That heeds God's Word of life,
Such nation shall be bless-ed
With peace all around,
Springing from Jesus our Lord,
Mediator between GOD and man,
The author of peace and joy and life
Bless-ed Jesus! Loving Saviour!
The Wonderful Counsellor!
Mighty Prince of Peace and Dayspring,
In the Kingdom of our GOD!

title: LET'S A SONG OF FREEDOM SING

stanzas.text:
LET'S a song of Freedom sing,
Brethren in this Freedom Day;
And with cheerful voices sing
Of Freedom thro' Christ our King.
For you and me He was born
In October---Freedom Day.

Herald loud the freedom Song,
Promised from the ages long.
By holy prophets of God
Written in His holy Word.
Sing, O sing ye favoured Ones.
That have known Christ precious ways.

What a joyful Freedom Day,
When we come to remember
The birth of our Saviour Christ!
Then, the angels sang with joy---
Glory to God in Highest:
Peace be to men of goodwill.

Ever present, ever kind
Jesus---Son of Bless-ed GOD!
For our freedom thou was born
And the glory of mankind,
Who in thy freedom do trust
Bless, O Bless us, Christ our Lord.

ON that glorious 'October Night”.
Hundreds of years ago
Was born the Saviour of the world,
Who brought Freedom to mankind.

Hark! Angelic voice say---
Good tidings of peace to all;
For in Bethlehem was born Christ,
Who brought Freedom to mankind.

On that peaceful and silent Night,
Shepherds their flocks were keeping.
Then came an angel robed in Light
With tidings of joy to all.

Glory to GOD in the Highest!
Peace be to men of goodwill,
Who will hear words of our Saviour---
Jesus the King of Salem.

For unto us a child was born:
To us a Son was given,
Bearing tidings of Salvation,
“Emmanuel” GOD is with us.

The 'Freedomites' are rejoicing:
Kingdomites voices array:
Singing the songs of Salvation,
Freedom and of Peace to all.

title: DEPTH OF LOVE IN GOD WE HAVE FOUND

stanzas.text:
DEPTH of love in God we have found,
With admirable joy,
That Jesus' birth to save mankind
Makes glad our hearts each day.

Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Be glad from day to day,
That Jesus' birth to save mankind
Fills us with joy.

In that night of His royal birth,
The angels anthems swell---
“Glory to God in the Highest,
Peace to men of goodwill”.

His portion were not earthly crowns
Nor earthly thrones His choice,
Though He was born in shepherds' inn
Yet He is King of kings.

The truth of this was never heard:
This joy was never known.
Our hearts were filled with sorrows then,
When in darkness we trod.

HAIL JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ!
Hail them in truth and love!
Behold the Tabernacle of the LORD---
The joy of our race!
What shall I bring to my LORD
In this great feast of our race,
Which is the Feast of Tabernacle of the
LORD?
Behold the Tabernacle of the LORD---
The tabernacle of our race!

Behold the Tabernacle of the LORD---
The Tabernacle of the LORD of Hosts
Brothers, sisters rejoice and sing,
For the Tabernacle of the LORD
Is now dwelling amongst our race
To show us the way of Life.
Behold the Tabernacle of the LORD
of Hosts---
The Tabernacle of our race!

Hail JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ!
Hail them for evermore!
Rejoice in God's Tabernacle on earth---
The Light of mankind!
Rejoice and sing hosanna,
Bearing the standard of Truth
In Jesus Christ, the Tabernacle of the LORD.
Hail JEHOVAH GOD and the Saviour
Christ
In this great feast of rejoicing!

title: HARK! THE VOICE OF BELOV-ED BRETHREN

stanzas.text:
HARK! The voice of belov-ed brethren,
Singing 'Hosanna', praising the Lord,
Rejoicing in this great day oh ye children,
For Salvation belongeth to JEHOVAH GOD.

LORD Keep us for we trust in Thee.
Our vows to thee we renew,
For thy goodness and Thy Loving-
kindness true.
To keep thy precepts help us O Lord
Thy path to see.

Happy youths, for thee are happy days!
Bless-ed happy ones sing with freedom
Let's rejoice with holy thoughts of the
Kingdom
Of Christ---the “Tabernacle” of GOD in
our race.

May our honest vows to Thee O LORD
Be acceptable, LORD, in Thy sight.
Give us understanding of Thy Word of life.
That in Thee we live with no carnal
thoughts, my God.

IN the Feast of Tabernacles
of the LORD of Hosts
With thanks we do rejoice.
As the happy Christians
Of JEHOVAH GOD,
We celebrate the Feast of feasts.

In the Feast of Tabernacles of the LORD.
There are blessings from GOD.
Let us go to the Feast of Tabernacles
with thanks,
And rejoice as Youths of Jesus' band,
To praise the LORD.

He that thirsts for the “Word of life”---
The Living water
Of the LORD our Creator,
Let him come to the Feast
Of Tabernacles
And take freely the “Word of life

Many nations and kindreds from
Every tongue and clime,
In the feast shall rejoice
With their vows and off'rings,
O with one accord,
To celebrate the Feast of feasts.

title: THIS IS THE FEAST OF REJOICING

stanzas.text:
THIS is the Feast of Rejoicing,
That brings peace to all our race.
I heard a great voice out of Heaven
Saying, saying,
“Behold the Tabernacle of God
Is with men!”
I heard a great voice out of Heaven,
Saying, saying.

“Behold the Tabernacle of GOD!
And He will dwell with men:
And they shall be His people;
GOD Himself shall be their GOD.”

Sing! The Tabernacle of GOD---
Christ the 'Horn of Salvation,”
Now bringeth deliverance to mankind:
Now to mankind
His Kingdom full of glory on earth,
Now brings peace,
And life everlasting to mankind,
Who dwell therein.

Behold the sheep of Jehovah,
Celebrating the great feast
The Feast that brings peace to God's people:
To God's people.
Grant us Thy blessings O JEHOVAH!
Thy blessings.
In Jesus Christ Thy Tabernacle
Shall life be found.

REJOICE brethren in the Lord
In this feast with one accord.
Praising the LORD of Hosts---
The Creator of mankind.
How precious are Thy ways,
O LORD our Hope and Shield!
We thank Thee, LORD, for keeping us
Safely from year to year.

Rejoice in the LORD!
Sing and praise His Name!
With one accord we meet
In the Feast of the LORD.
O what a lovely day
In the Kingdom of GOD,
When we celebrate the Feast
Of Tabernacles!

Drink from the life-giving stream,
Flowing from Jesus our Lord---
The “Dayspring” from above,
The Tabernacle of God.
Drink God's living Water:
Drink and ye shall be free,
Filling your hearts with Kingdom News
Of Bless-ed Hope and Life.

title: WE BID YOU WELCOME IN THE LORD

stanzas.text:
WE bid you welcome in the LORD
To this "Feast" of the LORD of hosts -
The great "Feast of Tabernacles"!
Which brings blessings to mankind.
And we thank JEHOVAH our God,
Who keeps us safely in His care
To celeb'rate the Feast of feast,
With joy from year to year.

We bid you welcome in this great Feast -
The Feast of Tabernacles of the LORD!
And now rejoice brethren in Christ,
And share each others love
In the Tabernacle Feast.

We bid you welcome brothers!
We bid you welcome sisters!
We bid you all welcome
To the Tabernacle Feast!

Brethren in Christ! Are ye prepared
To have the precious "rain" from God?
"YES"! Then give all your hearts to God,
With off'rings and thanks and vows,
Fill His Tabernacle with praise;
And let your hearts be always clean,
That ye might have God's precious "rain".
With joy from year to year.

IN Bless-ed Feast of Tabernacles,
O, there is joy!
And there is peace,
For those who love the LORD of hosts
And there is hope: Hallelujah!
Then bring forth your off'rings true
In the great Feast of Tabernacles.

Now in the Feast of Tabernacles,
There are blessings---
O blessings true!
And the Wisdom of God of Peace.
And to the celebrants shall be
Honour, love and riches true,
From Jesus Christ---the Tabernacle.

title: COME UNTO ME ALL YE THAT LABOUR

stanzas.text:
Come unto me all ye that labour
And are heavy laden.
Come unto me ye heavy laden
And I will give thee Rest.
Give thee Rest, give thee Rest.
Take my yoke upon thee,
For I am meek and lowly in heart.
Take my yoke upon thee,
And find rest to your souls.

Take my yoke upon thee,
Take my yoke upon thee
And ye shall find rest to your souls,
And ye shall find rest to your souls.
Take my yoke upon thee,
My yoke upon thee;
For I am meek and lowly in heart,
Meek and lowly in heart,

Take my yoke upon…thee, upon thee
And find rest……unto…..your souls.
And ye shall find rest unto your souls,
And ye shall find rest unto your souls.
Take my yoke upon thee
And ye shall find rest.
And ye shall find , and ye shall find,
And ye shall find rest to your…….souls.

title: COME NOW, LET US REASON TOGETHER
subtitle: (Call to Repentance, Drawn From Isa. 1:18-20 etc.)

stanzas.text:
“Come now, let us reason together”!
Saith the LORD, O saith the LORD!
“Though your sins be as scarlet,
They shall be as white as snow!
Though they may be red as crimson,”
O, “They shall be as white as wool!
If ye be willing and obedient.
Ye shall eat the good of the land”!

“If you now will refuse and rebel,
Ye shall be devoured with the Sword
For the mouth of the LORD hath
spoken it---
Saith the LORD, O saith the LORD.

O hear what the great LORD is saying
And return ye unto Him!
Your transgressions He’ll forgive
And no more remember them.
If ye do what the LORD is saying,
He will keep thee and protect thee;
For He’s the GOD of mercy and peace.
Therefore return now unto Him!

title: BEHOLD HE COMETH WITH THE CLOUDS
subtitle: (Second Presence of Christ)

stanzas.text:
BEHOLD He cometh with the clouds
To set His Kingdom here on earth!
Jesus our Lord has come to reign;
And seeing eyes have discerned Him.
Messiah, the Saviour of mankind,
He has come now to reign!
All the wicked ones on earth,
Wailing because of Him,
For His glorious signs appearing here on earth.
O rejoice ye people of the Lord!
For the Lord has come to reign.

The Lord has come to reign!
The Lord has come to reign!
The Lord has come to reign in Pow'r!
O rejoice ye people of the Lord!
For the Lord has come to reign.

Jesus our Lord has come to reign,
Showering His blessings on all
Who obey and do His Will on earth.
For'er in Him we'll dwell.
Sound His presence far and wide
To Kindreds of the earth:
And His endless praises day by day be sung.
Rising high in melody divine
“O, the Lord has come to reign”!

title: KNOW THIS ALSO THAT IN THE LAST DAYS
subtitle: (Counterfeit Witnesses and The Last Days)

stanzas.text:
“KNOW this also that in the last days,
Perilous times shall come.
Counterfeit witnesses shall arise with lies.
Proclaiming themselves as witnesses of GOD.
Counterfeit witnesses---men of corrupt minds!
Full of silly women led away with divers lusts!
O! Counterfeit witnesses shall men call them.
saith the LORD,
For they are not chosen ones of the LORD!”

Counterfeit witnesses!
Men of corrupt minds, destitute of the Truth.
Counterfeit witnesses, full of 'Jezebels'!
Counterfeit witnesses, rejected of GOD!
Creeping from house to house leading
silly women!
Such ones, Counterfeit witnesses shall they
be called.

“False accusers and deceiving ones!
Ever learning, void of Truth!
They are all in hypocrisy speaking lies,
Proclaiming themselves as witnesses of GOD!
Departing from Truth to doctrines of devils!
Turning their ears from the Truth and turning
to fables!
O! Counterfeit witnesses shall men call them!
saith the LORD:
As they creep from house to house, laden
with sins”.

“As Jann's and Jambres withstood Moses
These also resist the Truth;
But they shall proceed no further, saith the
LORD.
For their folly is manifested to all.
Presumptuous, blasphemers, disobedient ones!
Having a form of godliness denying the Truth!
And speaking lies in hypocrisy! Saith the
LORD of hosts.
For they are rejected ones of the LORD.”

title: OH! I LOOKED, AND LO A LAMB STOOD
subtitle: (Drawn from Rev. 14:1; 7:9)

stanzas.text:
OH! I looked, and lo a Lamb stood on Mount
Zion:
And with Him, a hundred, forty and four
thousand,
Having their Father's Name written in their
foreheads.
Thy Kingdom has come O LORD!
Thy Kingdom has come O LORD!
How beautiful upon the mountains---
The feet of Him that brings good tidings.
How beautiful upon the mountains!

Ten men shall hold the skirt of Him---
The skirt of Him that is a Jew;
And they shall say, “We will go with you:
For we have heard that God is with you”.

Ten men shall hold the skirt of Him---
The skirt of Him that is a Jew;
And they shall say, “We will go with you:
For we have heard that God is with you”.

I beheld, and lo great multitude of Christians,
Which no man could number, from all nations
and tongues,
All robed in righteousness, and with palms in
their hands.
And they stood before the Lamb,
And they stood before the Lamb
In God's glorious Kingdom here on earth,
Singing the praises of JEHOVAH,
Who saved them from great tribulation.

title: THE FOUNDATION OF THE LORD STANDETH SURE

stanzas.text:
THE Foundation of the LORD standeth sure.
What the LORD hath planteth, it standeth sure.
The Foundation of the LORD standeth sure for
ever
It bringeth peace to all the faithful ones of GOD.
Hear what the LORD our GOD hath said!
It bringeth peace to faithful ones.

The Foundation of the LORD standeth sure.
It bringeth peace to faithful ones.
The Foundation of the LORD standeth sure---
The Foundation of God's “Stronghold”.
God's 'Mountain' has come to stay;
Formed by JEHOVAH, thro' His Anointed.
The Foundation of God's “Stronghold”:
The Kingdom of God has come to stay.

Soon this wicked profane world shall pass away:
But the Kingdom of our GOD it standeth sure---
Christ the Chief Corner Stone reigneth sure
forever.
He has now come to reign and guide His
faithful ones
O what a joy to dwell in Him!
He is the Mighty Prince of Peace!

When this wicked evil world has passed away.
When Satan and his wicked ones shall be
destroyed,
When we shall enter in the Joy of our Lord
O what a glorious hope we've found in Jesus
Christ!
O, brethren, let us now rejoice!
For now our salvation is nigh.

title: THOUGH THE GODLESS BOASTED IN ALL THEIR STRENGTH

stanzas.text:
THOUGH the godless boasted in all their
strength,
Yea! Forever they have failed and fallen!
Their excellency boasted in their strength and
failed.
O, how are the mighty fallen!
Like Goliath of old, they've fallen,
And be no more in their pride!
The modern David then rejoiced and said:
'Now where are they with all their pride?'

“Where are they! Where are they
With all their pride?”
Belov-ed ones of God should say:
“Though the godless boasted in all their
strength.
Yet, like Philistines of old they flee.”

Though the godless will for a while abide
A day there will be when they'll be destroyed.
The LORD's Great Day of wailing and
tribulation---
The Vengeance of JEHOVAH GOD.
Satan and all his wicked ones
For evermore shall be destroyed
Then the faithful ones of the LORD rejoice,
“The LORD hath done great things for us”!

JEHOVAH, I will dwell
In Thy Tabernacle with joy,
And praise Thy Holy Name, O LORD of hosts,
With joy in all I do.
In the Tabernacle of God
Will I praise JEHOVAH
Thy KING of kings.
Glory be to JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ!
Glory, glory be to His anointed ones,
Who dwell on earth with men!

O! The Tabernacle of God
Is now dwelling and reigning amongst
our race.
People of GOD now on earth rejoice
For the Tabernacle.

As for me and my house,
We'll serve the LORD, with all our hearts,
To know Thy Lovingkindness by Thy grace,
In Thee our LORD, we trust.
Hallelujah! Praise JEHOVAH!
In His Mercy rejoice
And live in Christ:
In the goodness of the LORD repent ye people,
And trust in our LORD and KING to do
His Will
In His Tabernacle.

title: CONSIDER THE LILIES OF THE FIELD
subtitle: (Drawn from Matthew 6:25-33)

stanzas.text:
CONSIDER the lilies of the field, how they grow:
They do not toil nor do they spin:
And yet beautifully they grow.
Even Solomon in all his glories
Was not arrayed like one of these.
If God so clothe the grass of the field,
Which today is, and tomorrow fadeth,
Shaln’t He much more clothe thee,
O ye of little faith?
Then seek ye first the Kingdom of our God,
And its righteousness with strong faith;
Then all what you want shall be added you.
And life eternal in Promise Land.

"Take no thought for what ye shall eat,
Nor what ye shall clothe withal;
For, if God so clothe the grass,
Shaln’t He clothe ye of His likeness”?
Wake, wake, from thy sleep,
Wake, wake, from thy sleep.
Wake from thy sleep ye of little faith
And seek the Kingdom of the LORD.
Wake from thy sleep ye of little faith.

title: SEND THY LIGHT AND THY TRUTH

stanzas.text:
SEND Thy Light and Thy truth,
And let them lead me.
They that trust upon Thee, Lord,
Shall not be moved.
Bring me on to Thy HOLY HILL,
And to Thy Tabernacle.
Upon the harp will I praise THEE, O God,
my LORD.
For the Prince of Peace has come.
For the LORD dwelleth in Zion
In the City of our God.
There is peace for evermore
In the KINGDOM of our God.
We thank Thee, O LORD,
For this great kindness!
For this great kindness O Lord!

Jesus Christ the Prince of Peace
Is reigning on earth!
Be ye wise ye judges of the earth
And praise His name
“Kiss the Son lest He be angry,
And ye perish from the way”
He that sitteth King for ever
Is the King of Saints:
And He dwells amongst His holy ones
To the glory of JEHOVAH,
Who has made Him King of kings.
And in Zion there is peace---
In the city of our God.
We thank Thee, O LORD,
For this great kindness!
For this great kindness O God!

title: AFRICA WILL FIND REST IN CHRIST
subtitle: AFRICA FIND REST IN CHRIST ALONE

stanzas.text:
A    F    R    I    C    A    (AFRICA)
Will Find      Find Rest
Will Find Rest    in Christ
                     Alone.
Africa will find rest in Christ alone;
In Jesus the Saviour of the world.
Praise be to JEHOVAH our GOD and KING.
For sending Jesus Christ our Lord.

Jesus the Saviour of the world
Is now reigning in the Kingdom of God;
Rejoice and shout Hosanna! For our King
O! Ye the people of the World:
For in the Kingdom of God here on earth,
There is Peace and Rest in Christ alone.

Chorus: In Christ alone, in Christ alone.
Oh there is peace for evermore.
There is peace and rest in Jesus Christ alone.
Africa will find rest in Christ alone---
The Mediator of mankind.
For in the Kingdom of God here on earth
AFRICA Will Find Rest in Christ Alone.

HERE we've come together
The Lord to praise,
In His Kingdom for'er
His name to bless.
Jesus our dearest Friend!
To Thee we will sing praises,
In Thy Kingdom here on earth---
Thy “Holy Hill”.

Lord, these are fulfilments
Of Thy Promise
To gather together
Thy chosen ones.
Thy Name to glorify,
And to bring thank-off'rings too
Are to Thee our services
Here in Thy “Mount”

We are the happy brethren---
Brethren in the LORD:
Well belov-ed brethren
In Jesus Christ.
What'er you say, we will do
With joy, O our LORD GOD!
For Thy Wonderful Wisdom
Giveth us life and peace.

Chorus: We are happy brethren in Jesus Christ---
Well belov-ed brethren in the LORD.
We are happy for this great good gift
Of Truth revealed to us.
What'er you say, we will do
With joy, O our LORD God!
For Thy Wonderful Wisdom
Giveth us life and peace.

We are the happy soldiers---
Soldiers of the LORD,
Treading this evil world
To “Promise Land”.
Come distress we'll conquer yet:
Though dreary be the way,
And Vict'ry ever is sure
From GOD our Strength and Shield.

We are the happy pilgrims
Of the Kingdom of our God
Toiling on, O Toiling on,
Till we reach the golden shore,
We meet always with hearts of joy,
To praise our dear Redeemer's name,
With voices full of love and praise.
Speak and praise the Prince of Peace!

Chorus: We are happy pilgrims marching on,
To cleave to Christ the King.
Toiling on, toiling on,
Till the work is done.
Till we reach the golden shore,
Let the voice of hope be heard with joy,
And praise the Prince of peace.

Hear us, O Bless-ed Saviour!
Lord, we have now come to Thee,
Singing praises of Thy Name,
As Thy faithful followers.
Rejoice brethren, the Lord has come!
Give thanks for His glorious presence!
Boldly shall we on that day stand,
Praising Christ the King of kings.

title: O! BLESS-ED CITY OF OUR GOD

stanzas.text:
O! Bless-ed City of our God---
The Salem City of great joy!
O, beautiful art thou with peace.
Glorifying the Prince of Peace!
O Salem City---
“The blessed City of great Joy”
Salem City
The City of our God!

Chorus: Arise and shine, Thy Light has come!
Arise and shine, Thy Light has come!
O Salem City---
The Bless-ed City of great joy!
Salem City---
The City of our God!

Oh! Sing with joy, ye favoured ones:
The goodness of Jesus our Lord,
Who comes to save us from our sins,
And leading us to Salem Home.
The Salem City---
The perfect City of great love!
Salem City
The City of great love!

title: O! PRAISE GOD FOR HIS PRECIOUS WORD
subtitle: PART II

stanzas.text:
O! Praise God for His precious Word;
And thank Him for our daily bread!
Which He graciously to us give,
Who praise Him and to His Son cleave.

HAIL JEHOVAH and Christ!
From Whom all blessings flow;
Give praise and thanks and faithf'lly grow
In Wisdom of our Christ.

title: THE GRACE AND LOVE OF JESUS CHRIST
subtitle: PART I

stanzas.text:
The grace and love of Jesus Christ,
And Peace from GOD our Lord
Be with us as we now do leave
To our diff'rent abode,
That we in Truth abide.

LORD, dismiss us in peace
Now that we've heard Thy voice
And as we leave we will rejoice---
“Thy Truth our anchor is”.

title: LORD, MAY WE GO WITH THY BLESSINGS

stanzas.text:
LORD, may we go with Thy Blessings,
From this Thy Holy assembly,
Pardon all our faults that may be,
And bless us LORD with gift of Life.

Chorus: LORD, may Thy Blessings be with us.
And fill our hearts with love and peace
LORD, may Thy precious gift of Life.
Now be our joy for evermore.

LORD, as we leave this gathering
All to our different homes and works,
May we abide in Truth always,
And praising Thee at every hour.

May Thou be with us as we go,
Guarding us from all Satan's snares.
When home we reach we will thank Thee,
LORD, who guideth us safely home.

Hail JEHOVAH and Jesus Christ!
Hail Them, with joy and loving hearts!
Hail Them, O hail Them as we go,
Brethren, again till we will meet.

ARISE! Ye youths---ye sons of Light!
Chase the foes, with strength in Christ.
Gird thy armour---that's the decree!
Till the godless people flee.

Chorus: Oh! Arise, ye mighty nation!
And rejoice, ye mighty nation;
For the Victory is the LORD'S
Bearing forth the truth with gladness.
As the soldiers of Jesus!
As the soldiers of Jesus!
As the soldiers of Jesus!
Bearing forth the Truth with gladness.
For the victory is the LORD'S

Wake! Arise! And spread the Gospel
O'er the world till all is well!
Shew forth the Vict'ry of the LORD,
Treading where our Master trod.

Let's trust in GOD and do the right;
And speak the Truth without fright,
Speaking it with strength in the LORD,
Hoping for His sure reward.

There is Freedom for all
In the Kingdom of our GOD.
O! Praise JEHOVAH our God and King
For Choosing Gideon Urhobo
In the beauty of His Holiness.
       We thank Thee, Lord, We thank Thee, LORD,
       For this good privilege.
       We praise Thee, LORD, our GOD and King,
       For all our Joy and Peace.

Oh! Onward we shall march with joy,
       For there is Freedom for all;
       For in the name of Jesus Christ,
We shall conquer as we go.
There is Victory.
       In the Blessed Kingdom of our GOD!
There is Freedom!
       There is Victory and there is Freedom
In the Kingdom of our Lord and King!

We thank Thee, Lord!
       We praise Thee JEHOVAH GOD,
       For our Victory thro' Thy Holy Name.
There is Freedom!
       There is Freedom!
There is Victory
       There is Victory
There is Joy and Peace and Rest
In the Blessed Kingdom of GOD---
       The desire of mankind.

Chorus: God's Kingdom on earth has come---
       The Kingdom of Peace and of Joy---and Rest
       We thank Thee, Jehovah God,
       For choosing Gideon Urhobo
       For the Kingdom of God is the Hope of
                               Mankind.
       That brings Victory and Freedom to mankind.
       Hallelujah! Praise ye the Lord,
       For Victory over all our foes.

We praise Thee, Lord, our GOD and KING,
For all our Joy and Peace.
We thank Thee, LORD, we thank Thee, LORD,
For our Victory over all our foes.
